title: cool_mita_(miside)
body:
Cool Mita, also known as Cappie, is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

Like most other Mitas, Cool Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[dark blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

Her clothing closely matches default Mitas - she wears [[red thighhighs]], a [[blue_skirt|blue]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] skirt, a [[red sweater]] and a [[red choker]].

Her unique characteristics that distinguish her from other Mitas include her [[teardrop tattoo]] below her left eye, her [[ponytail]] hair style, her [[blue gloves]], and most importantly - her [[blue_hat|blue]] [[animal_ear_headwear|cat-eared]] [[cabbie hat]].

Sometimes depicted with a [[hitachi magic wand]], due to an in-game scene where she accidentally shows it to the player.

title: hirako_shinji
body:
[[Bleach]] character.

[b]Shinji Hirako[/b] is the leader of the Visored, a group of exiled Shinigami who possess Hollow powers. He is also the former Captain of the Gotei 13's 5th Division.

Laid-back and calm, often with a large grin on his face, he is nonetheless flustered in the face of [[Sarugaki Hiyori|Hiyori Sarugaki]]'s insults.

17 months after the defeat of [[Aizen Sousuke|Aizen]], Shinji is reinstated to his former position as Captain of the 5th Division, in place of Aizen himself.

h4. See Also
* [[Sakanade (Shikai)|]]
* [[Sakashima Yokoshima Happoufusagari]]

title: sagisawa_fumika
body:
[i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. A college student who works part time at her uncle's bookstore, Fumika is a girl who loves books and often gets lost in them. She is shy and dislikes talking to people. She appears in THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA MASTER Cool jewelries! 002. Due to her popularity, she was selected for the seventh CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Himekawa Yuki]], [[Ichihara Nina]], [[Miyamoto Frederica]], and [[Hayami Kanade]]. Her CV is [[Ichimichi Mao]].

title: raj_koothrappali
body: Rajesh Ramayan "Raj" Koothrappali, Ph.D. is a fictional character and one of the main protagonists on the 2007-2019 CBS television series [[The Big Bang Theory]], portrayed by British-Indian actor Kunal Nayyar. He is one of four main male characters in the show, alongside Sheldon Cooper, Leonard Hofstadter and Howard Wolowitz to appear in every episode of The Big Bang Theory. Raj is based on a computer programmer that the show's co-creator, Bill Prady, knew when he was a programmer.

title: leonard_hofstadter
body: Ostensibly the main character of [[The Big Bang Theory]], Leonard is the most normal of the guys by never having any outlandish quirks and generally operates as the Only Sane Man. He (and his friends) work at Cal Tech, his field being in Experimental Physics. He has lived with Sheldon since late 2002 and is his best friend, though Sheldon's quirks annoy him to no end. He instantly gained a crush on Penny when she moved into the apartment across the hall and much of the show is about how they both change from interacting with each other.

title: gamera
body:
The titular [[turtle]] [[kaiju|kaiju]] from the [[Gamera (series)|]] series.

In most of his iterations, Gamera is an ancient, prehistoric creature that was either genetically modified or mutated. Thanks to the volatile substances stored within his body, he has the powers of fire breath and jet-propelled flight. In some depictions, he also has telepathy and is capable of sensing human emotions. He most often acts as a guardian, protecting humanity against other monsters.

title: techno_police_21c
body:
[b][i]Techno Police 21C[/i][/b] (テクノポリス21C [i]Tekunoporisu Nijūisseki[/i]) is a 1982 [[Japan]]ese [[science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]], [[mecha]] and [[police]] action anime film made by [[toho_(film_company)|Toho Productions]] and produced by [[JVC]]. It was released in August 7, 1982.

Techno Police started in 1978 as an idea for a TV series from Artmic Studio founder Suzuki Toshimichi as a coproduction with Studio Nue. After 4 years in development the series was scrapped and the existing footage was compiled into an 80 minute movie and distributed by Toho.

Hisaishi Joe, who provides the synth-jazz score and is well known in the west for having created the soundtracks of several anime and live action films. Part of the animation and design staff were also [[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] from Studio Nue, who are now famous for their mecha designs from [[MACROSS]]. Their work in Techno Police actually served them as preparation during the pre-production design phase of the first Macross series.

English dubbed versions of the film were released in VHS format during 1984 and 1987. Outside of the English speaking world unedited video versions of Techno Police 21C were seen in France, Germany and Spain, with even a theatrical run in Cuba.

In 1994/5 Techno Police was re-released by Best Film & Video Co on NTSC VHS to cash in on the popular rise in anime and Cyberpunk at the time with OVA's such as [[Bubblegum Crisis]], [[Appleseed]], [[Dangaiou]], [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor|Patlabor]], [[A.D. Police Files|AD Police]], [[Armitage III]] and Cyber City Oedo 808.

h4. See also

* [[Technoid]]s
* [[Scanny]]
* [[Blader]]
* [[Tom (Techno Police)]]
* [[Fubuki Eren]]

title: a.d._police_files
body:
A 3-episode [[science fiction]] OVA released in 1990. 

The [b]A.D. Police Files[/b] series is a [[cyberpunk]] prequel to the original [[Bubblegum Crisis]] [[mecha]] series from the 80s.

The OVA was produced by Youmex and animated by Artmic and AIC. Its first episode was released in May 25, 1990, while the last one was released in November 22, 1990. Each episode was 26 minutes long. 

A.D. Police Files was originally intended to be a more complete and longer mini-series, but due to a legal conflict between Artmic and Youmex, the production of the series was stopped with only three complete episodes made, thus they were released as an OVA instead.

h4. See also

* [[Caroline Evers]]
* [[Billy Fanward]]

title: future_cop:_lapd
body:
[b]Future Cop: LAPD[/b] is a 1998 third-person [[science fiction]] and [[cyberpunk]] [[3D]] shooter [[video game]] developed by EA Redwood Shores and published by Electronic Arts and released first for the [[PlayStation 1]] console, then Mac OS and Microsoft Windows. The game was released in Japan in 1999. 

In the game, players assume the role of a [[police]] officer [[pilot]] for the [[X1-Alpha]], a [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] designed to fight in the "Crime War" in Los Angeles, California, USA during the year 2098. 

Despite its poor sales, the game received generally positive reviews.

title: cyberpunk
body:
A [[science fiction]] genre. Basic themes include the dehumanizing effects of technology, and the accompanying societal breakdown. Think dark and dirty, with lots of [[wire]]s and [[neon lights|neon]].

[b]Cyberpunk[/b] is a postmodern dystopian genre noted for its focus on [b]”high tech and low life"[/b]. The name is a portmanteau of cybernetics and punk, and was originally coined by American science fiction author Bruce Bethke as the title of his short Sci-Fi story [i]Cyberpunk[/i], written in 1980.

Cyberpunk can cover numerous themes and motifs but generally involve reflecting on the current anxieties of society and amping them up to an extreme; things like mass surveillance, corporate monopolization, climate change, mass media, artificial intelligence and any other themes can thus be accomodated by a cyberpunk setting.

For the series of the same name, see [[Cyberpunk (series)]].

title: united_nations
body:
The United Nations (abbreviated UN in English, and ONU in French and Spanish), is an international organization whose stated aims are facilitating cooperation in international law, international security, economic development, social progress, human rights, and achievement of world peace. It was founded in 1945 after [[World War II]] to replace the League of Nations, to stop wars between countries, and to provide a platform for dialogue. It contains multiple subsidiary organizations to carry out its missions. There are 193 member states, including every internationally recognised sovereign state in the world but Vatican City.

The United Nations Headquarters reside in international territory in New York City, with further main offices at Geneva, Nairobi, and Vienna. The organization is financed from assessed and voluntary contributions from its member states, and has six official languages: Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian, and Spanish.

The United Nations peacekeepers are required to wear their [[military uniform]]s where they come from, along with a [[blue helmet]] or a [[blue hat|]] [[beret]]. Their [[military vehicle]]s are also painted white.

h4.See also

* [[U.N. Spacy]]

title: d_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. Member of [[Perilous Siege (nikke)|]] together with [[K (Nikke)|]].

The leader of Perilous Siege. Not a single wicked soul will escape from her grasp, so long she believes their death will be of benefit to the world. Has a tendency to play up her persona when carrying out a mission.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[black coat|black]] [[long coat|long]] [[hooded coat]] with her [[hood up]], wears a [[black shirt]] with [[tactical clothes]] on top, wears [[black gloves]], [[grey shorts|grey]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[short shorts]], with a [[holster]] where she carries a [[gun]], she also wears [[black footwear|black]] and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. Can be seen carrying a [[hatchet (axe)|]] during her missions along with her [[submachine gun]] and a [[bag]] on her back.

Illustrators: [[Dramz|D.ramz]] (default), [[Aronman]] (Killer Wife)

h4. Skins

* !post #7308956: [[D (killer wife) (nikke)|Killer Wife]]
* !post #8371534: [[D (killer wife) (secret party cleaner) (nikke)|Secret Party Cleaner]]

title: d_(killer_wife)_(nikke)
body:
Undercover variant of [[D (Nikke)|D]] from [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. 

To obtain information on her target, D disguised herself as a young married woman. She plays the role of a kind and gentle wife perfectly. 

She still wields her [[hatchet (axe)|hatchet]] for close quarters, but has swapped her [[submachine gun]] out for a [[sniper rifle]]. D also swapped out her tactical outfit for a [[dongtan dress]] as part of her disguise as newlyweds with the [[Commander (nikke)|player character]] for a story event.

Illustrator: [[Aronman]]

title: saimin_seishidou
body:
[[Saimin Seishidou]] ("Sexual Instruction by Hypnosis"), is an erotic doujin manga by [[Aiue Oka]]. With the power of [[hypnosis]], the male protagonist [[tanaka_hajime_(saimin_seishidou)|Tanaka Hajime]] impersonates himself as a sexual instructor at his school.

The series has also spawned a hentai anime adoption, as well as two visual novels: [[Saimin Gakushuu|Saimin Gakushuu -Secret Desire-]] (2021) and [[Saimin Seishidou -Secret Lesson-]] (2024)

For her default costume, she wears a [[grey sweater|grey]] [[virgin killer sweater|virgin killer]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with a [[heart cutout|heart]] [[cleavage cutout]], [[blue pants]] and [[brown boots]].

When a character's eyes light up in [[excited|excitement]], usually with a yellow four-pointed sparkle in the center. [[Sparkle]]s may also appear around their head.

title: convenient_censoring
body:
Obstructing the view of genitals (or some other sensitive anatomical features) using several devices within a scene, such as unnecessary smoke or views with obstacles immediately in front of the viewer. Note that this tag mostly applies to obstructions that happen to be there against all odds, not cases where characters are deliberately covering themselves with something other than clothes.

[i]Example:[/i] Hair or wings that are draped over a girl's nipples don't necessarily count as convenient censoring, but if she is jumping/rolling/moving, and they just so happen to move in the way of her nipples in the process, that [i]is[/i] convenient censoring.

For artificial obstructions that are [i]external[/i] to the scene, like a [[bar_censor|black bar]] or a [[mosaic_censoring|mosaic]] pattern, use the [[censored]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[convenient leg]]
* [[convenient uncensoring]]
* [[hair censor]]
* [[hair over breasts]]
* [[interface censor]]
* [[soap censor]]
* [[steam censor]]
* [[tail censor]]
* [[wing censor]]

title: copium_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] involving a fictional inhalable substance that allowed the user to "cope" with harsh reality, usually via an [[oxygen mask]].

The word "copium" is a portmanteau of "cope" (to create a psychological defense of a lighter belief to deal with a harsh truth) and [[opium]] (a [[drugs]]).

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/copium]

title: era_bricks_(meme)
body:
In early 2023, [[meme]]s were made about the [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] army putting explosive [[reactive armor]] (ERA) on seemingly everything, following deliveries of [[Leopard 2]] tanks from [[Poland]] as a part of NATO aid for the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]].

The memes spread to [[4chan]]'s /pol/, /k/ and [[Reddit]]'s r/NonCredibleDefense sub where ERA bricks were used as an exploitable, being edited onto image macros and meme templates along with Ukrainian soldier-coded Flork of Cows characters.

These ERA memes were also called "Cope Bricks" in reference to [[Copium (meme)|]] and [[Cope Cage]]s.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Explosive Reactive Armor (ERA)":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/explosive-reactive-armor-era]

title: elden_ring
body:
Elden Ring is a 2022 action role-playing game developed by [[fromsoftware|FromSoftware]] and published by [[bandai namco|Bandai Namco Entertainment]]. Directed by [[Miyazaki Hidetaka]] with worldbuilding provided by fantasy writer [[George R.R. Martin]].

In the game, players control a customizable player character on a journey to repair the titular [[Elden Ring (object)|]] and become the new Elden Lord.

title: exhibitionism
body:
A fetish involving exposing one's body, either partially or entirely, or to commit sexual acts in public areas. The participant is almost always willing and often makes an overt effort to gain the attention of onlookers.

While similar to (and often overlaps with) [[zenra]], exhibitionism differs from zenra in the emphasis on exposing private parts or sexual arousal from being seen by others, whereas zenra involves [[nude]] people doing various activities, sexual or not, as if it were a normal occurence.

This tag is applicable when:

* Character(s) is seen with exposed private parts and/or in nude in public places, willingly or not. 
* Character(s) is seen committed sexual acts within the presence of other people or the [[crowd]].
* Character(s) is overtly and actively exposing their nudity toward others (such as the viewer, etc.) or is aware of their state of nudity but does not attempt to cover it.
* Character(s) is wearing a clothes so revealing that it would exposes their private parts, especially in public places. Do not apply this tag simply because character is wearing [[revealing clothes]], only apply when character is shown to be attempting to garner attention or are aware that other people saw them.

This tag is [b]not[/b] applicable when:

* Character(s) is not in a public place. Selfies and livestreams should not get tagged.
* Character(s) is wearing [[revealing clothes]], but the setting is not in public or in other's presence, such as in a blank background.
* Blank background. Use [[flashing]] for that.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "[[nudist]]" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "exhibitionism" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "[[zenra]]" is applicable.

h4. See also
h5. Other pubic indecency tags
* [[public indecency]]
** [[public nudity]]
** [[public masturbation]]
h5. Related tags
* [[change in common sense]]
* [[male swimwear challenge]]
* [[nudist]]
** [[nude beach]]
* [[flashing]]
* [[painted clothes]]
** [[naked paint]]
* [[sex battle]]
* [[stealth sex]]
* [[streaking]]
* [[strip game]]
* [[voyeurism]]
* [[zenra]]

title: nudist
body:
The practice of [[nude|wearing little to no clothing]] to be "closer to [[nature]]," treating nudity as natural and nothing to be ashamed of.

This tag overlaps with (but not necessarily relates to) [[exhibitionism]] and [[zenra]], as nudists can be naked [[indoors]] (such as the privacy of their home), as opposed to the aforementioned fetishes that emphasize [[public nudity]] and exposure to others. Nudism is usually treated as a matter of personal preference rather than deliberate titillation.

Do not apply this tag simply because the character is naked. Other evidences in the image such as the character performing various mundane task naked, treat their nakedness as an ordinary matter, or is not involved in a sexual situation is required to identify this tag.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "nudist" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "[[exhibitionism]]" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "[[zenra]]" is applicable.


h4. See also

* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[nude beach]]
* [[zenra]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Naturism":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naturism

title: ironclad
body:
A type of [[warship]] prevalent in the latter half of the 19th century. Characterized by their iron, usually sloped armor (although later ones have steel armor, or some composite of the two) and use of coal powered steam power (although many earlier ones also kept sails for back up or fuel saving reasons).

They were later superseded by pre-dreadnought [[battleship]].

title: war
body:
An organized, armed, and, often, a prolonged conflict that is carried on between states, nations, or armed political organization using [[army|armies]] and [[soldier]]s. Typically to either resolve diplomatic or political disputes or as an aggressive diplomatic tool against other countries. War are usually carried out between two or more [[military]] of the opposing factions.

This tag can be applied to any depiction of war, either historical or fictional, as well as various aspects of it (such as death and destruction), either literally or symbolically.

title: naval_dress_uniform
body:
A [[naval uniform]] designed for non-combat, parade and ceremonial use. Just like the [[military dress uniform]] of other branches, they usually have more distinctive designs, that show various [[insignia]]s and other decorations like [[medal]]s or [[ribbon bar]]s. As well, naval dress uniforms tend to be clearer in showing [[military rank insignia|rank or rate]] than those of land or air forces, with officer ranks displayed as bands on the cuffs and/or shoulder boards, and enlisted rates displayed on the upper arms. 

h4. Examples

* !post #4732949: Officer's dress whites.
* !post #3808860: Officer's dress blues. Note the [[military rank insignia]] on the cuffs.
* !post #8222231: Enlisted dress blues. 

h4. See also

* [[Naval working uniform]]
* [[Military dress uniform]]

title: naval_uniform
body:
A [[military uniform]] worn by members of a navy. Typically these will be either white or khaki in summer or tropical regions, and black or very dark blue in winter or cold regions. A [[naval dress uniform]], meant for ceremonial purposes, would usually be worn for special occasions while ashore, but rarely worn on an active vessel. Conversely, a [[naval working uniform]] is the typical clothing worn while out at sea, and is usually meant more for protection than for good looks. 

h4. Examples 

* !post #6226073: [[Naval working uniform]]s
* !post #3808860: [[Naval dress uniform]]
* !post #2382164

h4. See also

* [[List of Armed Forces]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: naval_working_uniform
body:
A [[naval uniform]] that is worn by during day to day work on a ship. At-sea uniforms are intended more for protection than for good looks: long [[pants]] and long sleeve [[shirt]]s protect against sunburn and fire. The traditional [[sailor collar]] was another method to protect the neck and shoulder area, though more modern uniforms are made of fire-resistant materials to assist as well. Officer's uniforms are also distinctly different from those of the enlisted, usually wearing blue or khaki clothes, depending on the time period and nationality. As with [[naval dress uniform]], at-sea uniforms of both officers and enlisted qualify for this tag. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8307272
* !post #2191029

h4. See also

* [[Naval dress uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Navy Working Uniform":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Navy_Working_Uniform

title: niconico
body:
Niconico (ニコニコ) is a popular Japanese video sharing site. The site is sometimes still known by its old name, Niconico Douga (ニコニコ動画, [i]Niconico Video[/i]), and similarly so still believed to require registration to watch any videos onsite, when access has been loosened up over the years.

Niconico has several sister sites:

* Niconico Seiga (ニコニコ静画, [i]Niconico Imageboard[/i]), an imageboard. There was a NSFW section called Niconico Shunga (ニコニコ春画), but this was shut down on January 29th 2025. 
* Niconico Nama Hosou (ニコニコ生放送, [i]Niconico Live Streaming[/i]), a livestreaming service. Often abbreviated as ニコ生 or ニコなま.
* Nicopedia (ニコニコ大百科), a wiki system. Each article also has a [[2channel]]-like [[oekaki]] board.

A unique feature of Nicovideo is that user comments are displayed as a scrolling feed over the video. See [[Danmaku comments]].

Niconico's mascot character is called "Niconico TV-chan (ニコニコテレビちゃん)":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/695104 (tagged here as [[Terebi-chan]]).

This tag is used for posts referencing the site itself, and locations associated with the site (such as the old [[niconico headquarters (harajuku)|Harajuku HQ]]), as well as for various Niconico(-adjacent) characters that have gained some fanart.

h4. See also

* [[AcFun]]
* [[Bilibili]] (A Chinese video site with similar style)

* [[2024 niconico cyberattack]]

title: dragon_ball_(object)
body:
The namesake objects of the [i][[Dragon Ball]][/i] series are seven magical [[orb]]s that have a number of red stars corresponding to their order in the sequence (from 1 to 7).

When all seven Dragon Balls are collected and gathered together, they allow the user to summon [[Shenron (dragon_ball)|a powerful dragon]] who will grant a number of wishes (originally one, later three). Once the wish is granted, it cannot be granted again, and the balls fly off to the ends of the earth and become nothing but inert stone until a year has passed, at which point they become Dragon Balls again.

Earth's dragon balls were created by an alien from planet [[Namek]] named [[Kami-sama (dragon ball)|Kami]].

body: Shiratori Aira is a supporting character of the manga series [[Dandadan]]. She is a student who was formerly popular at the same school as [[Ayase Momo]] and [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]. After finding one of [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]'s kintama, Aira comes under the pretense that she is the "chosen one" that is meant to protect the world from evil and sees [[Ayase Momo]] as being her enemy. However, she unadmittedly serves as one of her main allies whenever the two are faced with the paranormal.

title: mexican_standoff
body:
[b]Mexican standoff[/b] is a strategic deadlock or impasse, in which no party can act in a way that ensures victory.

In popular culture, the Mexican standoff is often portrayed as two or more opponents with [[weapon]]s [[aiming|aimed]] at each other, usually at extremely close range, such that each opponent feels equally threatened and does not believe he can strike or shoot first without endangering his own life. 

h5. Example
* !post #2966291

* [[at knifepoint]]
* [[battle]]
* [[crosscounter]]

title: surrendering
body:
An act of giving up the [[fighting|fight]] in order to prevent further potential negative consequences, such as [[death]]. Often signified with a [[white flag]].

A person who is surrendering may be shown with [[arms up]] or [[arms behind head|behind their head]] to signify that they are unarmed and are no longer willing to resist.

title: batman
body:
A superhero from [[DC Comics]] and the titular main hero of the [i][[Batman (series)|]][/i] franchise.

His real name is [[Bruce Wayne]], a wealthy man who witnessed his parents' murders and vowed to fight crime in Gotham City. He dons a black [[superhero costume]] and bat-themed mask, and utilizes gadgets and martial arts rather than superpowers like traditional superheroes. Also known as [[the Dark Knight]].

In many crossover media, Batman is frequently depicted as a rival of [[Superman]], primarily due to their contrasting qualities. Such as Superman's usage of superhuman power compared to Batman's usage of gadgets, and their clashing philosophies regarding how to handle a villain.

He was created by the late Bob Kane and the late Bill Finger and debuted in [i]Detective Comics[/i] #27 (1939).

h4. See also

* [[Robin (DC)]]
* [[Superman]]
* [[Ougon Bat]]

h4.External links

Prior to her appearance in the [[Fate/Zero]] anime, she received a design by [[Sumita Kazuasa]] which was nicknamed [b]Iri Mainyu[/b].

title: capitano_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. Also known by his codename "The Captain", he is the first of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers.

He is a survivor of the Khaenri'ah Calamity, originally known as Thrain, and cursed with immortality by [[Ronova (genshin impact)|]], the Shade of Death.

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, he is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

title: messenger_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An Emanator of Remembrance aboard the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]].

She is portrayed [[faceless female|faceless]] (covered by a crystal), and wears a [[white hoodie|white]] [[hooded dress]] over a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress]]. In-game, they give access to the Forgotten Hall and Memory of Chaos game modes. 

Note that the appearance applies to persons associated with the Garden of Recollection: the Messenger should not be confused with Memosnatchers (post #8822199) if she is depicted in the Astral Express.

title: player_character_(splatoon)
body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. The player can choose between an [[Inkling Girl]] and [[Inkling Boy]]. Players who acquired the Octo Expansion in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]] are also given the option to select  [[Octoling Girl]] and [[Octoling Boy]] as well. With [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] making all four options available by default.

This tag is for both the Inklings and Octoling that serve as the player's character, and for swim form Inklings and Octolings (post #2028621). Essentially acting as a fusion for both the [[inkling_player_character]] and [[octoling_player_character]] tags. Just like with those two, do not use it for named non-player characters such as [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] or [[Marina_(splatoon)|]].

[b]See [[Inkling]] and [[Octoling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Inklings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Inklings and [[Octoling]]s.[/b]
h4. List of officially named player characters
* !post #7360649: [[Kaori_(splatoon)|]] and [[John_(splatoon)|]]
* !post #7430197: [[Surume_(splatoon)|]] and [[Cuttlefrsh_(splatoon)|]]

title: cabbie_hat
body:
Also known as a "newsboy cap".

It has a stiff [[visor]] in front and a band. The body of the hat is roundish and puffy. Not to be confused with [[beret]]s, which are often flat or floppy with the band under its body and no visor. It has a similar shape to a [[flat cap]], but the body of the cap is rounder, made of eight pieces, fuller, and paneled with a button on top.

title: sainan_high_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the students of Sainan High School in [[To LOVE-Ru]].

* [[Summer Uniform]]
Male Uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and [[green pants]] (plain pants in the anime, [[plaid pants]] in the manga).
Female Uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[green bowtie]], [[yellow sweater vest]], and [[plaid]] [[green skirt]].

* [[Winter Uniform]]

title: zaku_marine_type
body:
Fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MS-06M Zaku Marine Type[/b]

An experimental submarine combat variant of the MS-06F [[Zaku II]], it was first featured in the original design series [[Gundam MSV]].

After [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year One]] the surviving units were repurposed and refined to be used by the [[Earth Federation]]. Dark Blue colored units were deployed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] as the [b]Marine [[Hizack]][/b].

h4.See also
* [[Zaku Mariner]]

title: aviator_cap
body:
A [[hat]] made of leather or similar material, worn by aviation [[pilot]]s and motorsport drivers to keep their head warm and to provide it some protection. Often made with ear flaps and worn with [[aviator goggles]]. Superseded by [[pilot helmet]]s when [[cockpit]]s became enclosed.

h4. See also

* [[aviator goggles]]
* [[ushanka]]

title: pilot_helmet
body:
A modern [[helmet]] worn by [[pilot]]s or military aircrew. It largely replaced the leather [[aviator cap]]s used by early pilots. Flight helmets provide impact protection. They often feature a visor, [[headset]] or [[microphone]] for both communication and noise attenuation, mounting system for [[night vision device]] and [[head-mounted display]], as well as compatibility with [[oxygen mask]]s.

h4. See also

* [[aviator goggles]]
* [[space helmet]]
* [[assault visor]]
* [[Tag Group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flight helmet":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_helmet

title: konjiki_no_yami
body:
Konjiki no Yami (金色の闇, lit. Golden Darkness), is a major character from [[To LOVE-Ru]] and [[To LOVE-Ru Darkness]]. She is portrayed as the deadliest assassin in the galaxy who is hired to kill protagonist [[Yuuki Rito]], but instead ends up falling in love with him. 

Her character design, including shapeshifting abilities and weaponized body, is based on [[Eve (Black Cat)|]] of the [[Black Cat (series)|]] manga, which was written and drawn by the artist of [i]To LOVE-Ru[/i], [[Yabuki Kentarou]].

title: akms
body:
The variant of [[AKM]] [[assault rifle]] with an [[MP40]]-styled under[[folding stock]]. The letter S on "AKMS" stands for складной ([i]Skladnoy[/i]), Russian word for "folding". This tag does not mean the plural form of AKM. 

Not to be confused with the [[AKS-74]], which has triangular side-folding stock.

h4. See also

* [[AKMSU]]
* [[Kalashnikov rifle]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: akm
body:
The [b]AKM[/b] (Russian: Автома́т Кала́шникова модернизи́рованный "[[kalashnikov rifle|Kalashnikov]]'s Automatic [[Rifle]] Modernized") is a [[Soviet]] 7.62×39mm [[assault rifle]], designed in 1950s as the major improvement from the earlier [[AK-47]]. Main features of the AKM are its stamped receiver (visible rivets) instead of heavier milled one, slanted muzzle brake, and straighter fixed buttstock profile.

Its design was copied and manufactured by various Soviet satellite states, such as Hungarian [[AMD-65]] and East German [[MPi-KM]].   

h4. Examples

* !post #7746396: AKM
* !post #5829268: [[AK-47]]. Lack of rivets and wide rectangular indentation. 
* !post #6264963: [[Type 56 assault rifle|Type 56]]. Milled or stamped receiver, but with folding spike bayonet and removable muzzle nut.

h4. See also

* [[AKMS]]
* [[RPK]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: hippogriff
body:
The hippogriff or hippogryph is a legendary creature with the front half of an [[eagle]] and the hind half of a [[horse]].

It was invented at the beginning of the 16th century by Ludovico Ariosto in his Orlando Furioso. Within the poem, the hippogriff is a steed born of a mare and a griffin—something considered impossible. It is extremely fast and is presented as being able to fly around the world and to the Moon. It is ridden by magicians and the wandering knight Ruggiero, who, from the creature's back, frees the beautiful Angelica. Astolfo also borrows the hippogriff from Bradamante to go search for Roland's wits.

The hippogriff became a subject of visual art in the 19th century, when it was often drawn by Gustave Doré. 

For it's use in the Fate series, see [[Hippogriff_(Fate)|]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hippogriff":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hippogriff

title: ryuujou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Ryuujou[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. Her default outfit consists of a maroon/dark red [[kariginu]]-like vest over a [[white shirt]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], a [[magatama]] necklace, [[visor cap]] patterned off her real-life bow, [[thigh strap]]s holding [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, [[white socks]], and [[platform footwear]]. She emits blue flames with text reading "Imperial Edict" which is how she launches aircraft from her [[flight deck]] [[scroll]]. 

She talks in [[kansaiben|Kansai-ben]]. She is often nicknamed "RJ" and, with her cap, somewhat resembles a [[McDonald's]] worker. Near-constant victim of [[flat chest joke]]s in fanworks. Ironically, in game she is proud of her "distinctive silhouette" and never seems [[breast envy|envious]] of other girls' bosoms.

title: suzuya_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Suzuya[/i]. Designed by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]] with a [[hairclip]] and [[aqua eyes]]. She wears a brown [[school uniform]] with an orange [[ascot]], brown [[jacket]] and [[pleated skirt]], [[brown thighhighs]], and black [[loafers]] that have high heels. Her [[rigging]] includes multiple [[ship turret]]s with twin-[[cannon]] arrangements strapped two to her forearms, one on each thigh, and a larger one carried by a strap like a purse. She carries a mast like a backpack.

She has an energetic and informal personality, behaving like a typical high-school girl, with little sense of personal space and a frisky attitude. She's also frequently shown as being rather close to her sister-ship, [[Kumano (kancolle)|]].

title: kumano_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Kumano[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Like [[Suzuya (kancolle)|]], she wears a brown [[school uniform]] ([[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]], [[brown skirt]], [[brown thighhighs]]) and [[black footwear|black]] shoes.

Her [[rigging]] consists of all five 20.3 cm twin gun mounts plus two 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose mounts]] at base form but she discards the two left arm-mounted 20.3 cm mounts at kai form in favor of a [[flight deck]].

In stark contrast to her sister Suzuya, she speaks in a respectful and formal manner, evoking an ojou-sama type. However, she screams like a dolphin in battle. The scream itself (likened to a dolphin sound) is a meme.

body:

He is notorious for his tendency to became tilted, ragequit, and use numerous obscene profanities whenever he is losing. His catchpahse "[[You should kill yourself NOW (meme)|]]!" later spawned a [[meme]].

title: amatsukaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Amatsukaze[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Ogura Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] in a [[two side up]] hairstyle, decorated with windsocks acting as [[hair tubes]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[brown_dress|brown]] [[short_dress|short]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[grey neckerchief]] and [[lifebuoy]] clip, [[black hat|black]] [[mini hat]] styled after her real-life funnel, [[black choker]], [[single glove|single]] [[white gloves|white glove]] on her right hand, [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her own [[Rensouhou-kun]] on a bow hull piece to her right and quad 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] to her back.

She is implied to be a [[tsundere]]. As the historical [i]Amatsukaze[/i] was the testbed for [[Shimakaze (kancolle)|]]'s turbines, she is, in a way, Shimakaze's elder sister.

title: takanami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Takanami[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with notable long [[sidelocks]], and [[brown eyes]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]], with a [[yellow sports bra]] underneath her shirt. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back with a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She has a personality that is lacking in confidence. Her verbal tic is "かも" or "kamo", which usually means "maybe". The homophone "kamo" (written "鴨") can also mean [[duck]], so she is sometimes seen with ducks for this reason. This verbal tic is shared with [[Akitsushima (Kancolle)|]], who was introduced at the same time.

title: matoimaru_(arknights)
body:
[i]Matoimaru, Guard Operator of Rhodes Island, will wield her blade to wipe out the enemy.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 3[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Oni[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]172 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An excellent Oni warrior from Higashi. She exudes an incredibile bloodlust during combat, although she seems unaware fo this fact and forgets about these episodes. She fights with a [[naginata]].

She likes playing soccer and making flower arrengaments, which are described by others as very refined. She often organizes events around these subjects and drags other people in them, willing or not.

Her motif is likely based on the [[Ushi-oni]] yokai.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ōtsu Airi (Japanese), Qiwen (Chinese), and Chae Min-ji (Korean). Her art designer is [[ryuuzaki ichi]].

h4. Appearance

title: viviana_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard operator Viviana, once known as the Candle Knight.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Viviana Droste von Hochberg

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 21[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Elafia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]171 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]8 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Also known by her knight title [b]The Candle Knight[/b].

NPC and stage mini-boss introduced as part of event [i]Near Light[/i]. Formerly a noble of Leithania, she's a rising star Grand Knight of Kazimierz who wields a [[candlestand|chamberstick]] in battle. During Near Light, she meets and later faces off against [[Nearl (Arknights)|]], but concedes defeat.

Introduced as a playable character in the side-story [i]Zwillingstürme Im Herbst[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Ichimichi Mao|M·A·O]] (Japanese), Qin Ziyi (Chinese), Lena Tiemann (English and German), and Lee Seul (Korean). Her art designer is [[Chuzenji]].

title: chocolate
body:
[b]Chocolate[/b] comprises a number of raw and processed foods that are produced from the seed of the tropical cacao tree.

Chocolate has become one of the most popular flavors in the world. It is a common ingredient in many [[snack]]s and [[dessert]]s, including but not limited to [[cookie]]s, [[cake]]s, [[ice cream]], [[pudding]], [[pie]]s and [[candy]]. [[Gift]]s of chocolate molded into different shapes have become traditional on certain holidays: chocolate bunnies and eggs are popular on [[Easter]], chocolate coins on Hanukkah, Santa Claus and other holiday symbols on [[Christmas]], and hearts on [[valentine|Valentine's Day]]. Chocolate is also used in cold and hot beverages, including chocolate milk and hot chocolate.

title: shiroko_terror_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Similar in appearance to [[Shiroko (blue archive)|]]. Also goes by the name of "Anubis".

[spoiler]A version of Shiroko who remains the sole survivor of Abydos High School, exposed to Chroma by the Nameless Priests, which also altered her physical appearance. Shiroko would go on to serve the Nameless Priests directly under the protection of [[Phrenapates (blue archive)|]], until the main timeline's Sensei infiltrated the Ark of Atrahasis, leading to its subsequent destruction. In Volume 1 Chapter 3, Shiroko was summoned by [[Plana (blue archive)|]] to assist in subduing [[Hoshino Terror (blue archive)|Hoshino Terror]], whose mental state began to spiral similarly to hers.

As of the end of Volume 1 Chapter 3, Shiroko has now been appointed as a member of the General Student Council, and her Halo has slowly begun to heal, now that she's since let go of the guilt of losing her friends.[/spoiler]

She uses a [[SIG SG550]] [[assault rifle]] with a [[SIG P220/P226]] [[handgun]] as a sidearm. [spoiler]She additionally wielded the weapons of the deceased [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|Foreclosure Task Force]], but has since discarded them as a sign that she's begun to move on.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Ogura Yui]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8727368

title: mr._peabody_&_sherman
body:
A Jay Ward Productions property, originating out of [[Rocky & Bullwinkle]]. The original segment from the show, entitled "Peabody's Improbable History", features a genius dog named Mr. Peabody who adopts a human named Sherman. Every episode features the two of them using the Wayback Machine to go back in time to observe a historic figure. 

The segment would in the 2010s be spun-off into its own property, beginning first with the 2014 computer animated film by [[Dreamworks]], before being followed up by "The Mr. Peabody & Sherman Show," which aired on Netflix from 2015 to 2017.

title: dante_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Legendary Devil Hunter, Dante[/b]

[b]Dante[/b] is the main protagonist in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. He is the son of [[Sparda]] and [[Eva (devil may cry)|]], the twin brother of [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]], and the paternal uncle of [[Nero (devil may cry)|]]. As such, he is a half-demon.

A demon hunter by trade, he owns the eponymous shop named after the series. Wielding his [[rebellion (sword)|sword "Rebellion"]] and twin pistols [[Ebony & Ivory]], he became a devil killer to avenge the death of his mother and protect humankind.

Unlike Vergil, he also displays a spunky, cocky attitude. Voiced by Reuben Langdon in North America, and Morikawa Toshiyuki in Japan.

title: mistletoe
body:
A [[plant]] with rounded leaves and white berries. It's often associated with [[Christmas]], where there is a tradition of [[kiss]]ing under branches of mistletoe.

Not to be confused with [[holly]], which is another plant with spiky leaves and red berries. While red-berried species of mistletoe do exist ([i]Viscum cruciatum[/i], [i]Viscum rotundifolium[/i]) they still lack spiky leaves.

h4. See also

title: the_lazy_song_(bruno_mars)
body:
[b]The Lazy Song[/b] is a song by American singer-songwriter [[Bruno Mars]] from his debut studio album [i]Doo-Wops & Hooligans[/i] (2010). 

It is a lighthearted and humorous track that talks about taking a day off from work or responsibilities to just relax and do nothing. The song's lyrics are about Mars' desire to be lazy, stay in bed, and avoid any obligations, simply enjoying a day of leisure.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: The Lazy Song":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lazy_Song
* "Wikipedia: Doo-Wops & Hooligans":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doo-Wops_%26_Hooligans
* "Wikipedia: Bruno Mars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Mars

h4. See Also
* [[that's_what_i_like_(bruno_mars)|That's What I Like - Bruno Mars]]

title: that's_what_i_like_(bruno_mars)
body:
[b]That's What I Like[/b] is a song by American singer-songwriter [[Bruno Mars]] from his third studio album [i]24K Magic[/i] (2016). 

It is a R&B and pop song that talks about the finer things in life that Mars enjoys and is willing to provide for a special someone. The lyrics highlight various luxuries and pleasures, including jewelry, trips, designer brands, and other extravagant experiences. 

It stands as the highest-charting single in the [[United States]] from the album. The song was the world's fourth-best-selling digital single of 2017, with 9.7 million units, ranking among the best-selling singles worldwide.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: That's What I Like (Bruno Mars)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/That%27s_What_I_Like_(Bruno_Mars_song)
* "Wikipedia: 24k Magic (album)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24K_Magic_(album)
* "Wikipedia: Bruno Mars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Mars

h4. See Also
* [[the_lazy_song_(bruno_mars)|The Lazy Song - Bruno Mars]]

title: mitm_(arknights)
body:
[i]Vanguard Mitm refuses to work overtime without pay.[/i]

A playable Vanguard operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Pohl

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]November 19th[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]165 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An intelligence officer and liason in Kazdel for Rhodes Island. He is one of the main characters in the Story collection [i]A Kazdelian Rescue[/i].

His codename is based on the [i]Man-in-the-middle[/i] cyberattack.

His [[voice actor]]s are Fumiyoshi Shioya (Japanese) and Wang Fuping (Chinese). His art designer is [[yuan quanquan ren]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8838138: Default
* !post #8838149: Elite II

title: shikinami_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shikinami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]]. She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]], and [[brown eyes]]. She and [[Ayanami (kancolle)|]] wear a [[brown sailor collar]] version of the Fubuki-class [[serafuku]], complete with a [[brown skirt]]. In real life, [i]Shikinami[/i] was part of DesDiv19 alongside her sister [[Ayanami (kancolle)|]] and her half-sisters [[Isonami (kancolle)|]] and [[Uranami (kancolle)|]]. She first saw action in the battle of the Sunda Strait where she fired the torpedo that sank [[Houston (Kancolle)|]]. Later seeing action in the [[battle of Midway]] and Naval Guadalcanal, she rescued [[Shirayuki (Kancolle)|]]'s survivors in the battle of the Bismarck Sea and spent the rest of her combat duty as a convoy escort, where she was sunk in one of these in September 1944. h4. Appearance * !post #3226378: Base * !post #3775600: [[Shikinami Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] * !post #2804886: [[shikinami (yukata) (kancolle)|Yukata]] * !post #8731590: [[shikinami_(maizuru)_(kancolle)|Maizuru]] h4. [i]Ayanami[/i]-class destroyers * [[Ayanami (Kancolle)|]] * [b]Shikinami[/b] * Asagiri (Yet to be implemented) * Yuugiri (Yet to be implemented) * [[Amagiri (Kancolle)|]] * [[Sagiri (Kancolle)|]] * [[Oboro (Kancolle)|]] * [[Akebono (Kancolle)|]] * [[Sazanami (Kancolle)|]] * [[Ushio (Kancolle)|]] h4. title: teruzuki_(swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Teruzuki (kancolle)|]]. While considered an official costume, it has remained unreleased in the game apart from the 2018 calendar.

Her swimsuit consists of a [[white bikini]] worn with [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]].

title: mikuma_(2016_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]].

It consists of a plain [[red bikini]] and matching red [[flippers]], with a [[bodyboard]] carrying her real-life seaplane deck pattern and her nickname "Kumarinko" printed on it. The outfit gained notoriety for its [[bad anatomy]] and was never repeated, instead opting to go for a [[Mikuma (2017 swimsuit) (kancolle)|new swimsuit design]] that's been used since 2017.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2440523

title: mogami_(swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mogami (kancolle)|]].

Her base/kai swimsuit consists of a [[multicolored bikini|tricolor bikini]] top and [[white bikini]] bottom worn beneath a [[white jacket]], and grey [[sandals]]. It matches with [[Mikuma (2017 swimsuit) (kancolle)|Mikuma's own]] swimsuit costume.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2804866

title: mikuma_(2017_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The current [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]].

Following backlash to Mikuma's [[Mikuma (2016 swimsuit) (kancolle)|original swimsuit design]], she gained a new design that fixed the problems with the original. Her current swimsuit outfit consists of a [[green bikini]] top and [[white bikini]] bottom worn beneath a [[white jacket]], a [[white headband]], and brown [[sandals]].

* !post #2804873

title: haruna_(2016_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Haruna (kancolle)|]], exclusive to her [[Haruna Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] form. It was replaced in 2023 with a [[Haruna (2023 swimsuit) (kancolle)|new swimsuit design]].

She wears a [[white bikini]] under a [[white jacket]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sandals]] with [[strappy heels]], a single [[thigh strap]] containing an AA gun, and red [[bracelet]]s. Uniquely, her actual bikini was hidden from view until she was at least moderately damaged.

title: mikuma_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The two second remodels of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]].

Her kai ni [[serafuku]] is colored to match her sister [[Mogami (Kancolle)|]]: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[brown serafuku]] with a [[yellow sailor collar]] and a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. Her back funnel and mast-and-[[radar]] set are retained as well, plus her three 203 mm twin gun mounts (two on her legs and one handheld). Beyond this, her [[rigging]] takes two different forms depending on her specific kai ni.

In standard CAV kai ni, she retains her [[flight deck]]. In her alternate [i]Toku[/i] kai ni, she is reclassed as a transport cruiser/seaplane tender (AV) and her old flight deck is replaced with a new one that includes a large catapult, hangar, and a well deck for amphibious craft. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7137317: CAV Kai Ni
* !post #7137326: Transport cruiser

h4. [i]Mogami[/i]-class cruisers - kai ni

* [[Mogami Kai Ni (kancolle)|Mogami]] (CAV and transport cruiser)
* [b]Mikuma[/b] (CAV and transport/AV)
* [[Suzuya Kai Ni (kancolle)|Suzuya]] (CAV and CVL)
* [[Kumano Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kumano]] (CAV and CVL)

title: bell-bottoms
body:
Legwear, most commonly [[jeans]], that widen at the bottom, typically starting at the knees. Also known as flares. When they widen from the ankles only, it may also be called a boot-cut.

They grew fashionable in the 1960s, and are associated with with a variety of [[fashion]] styles, including [[hippie]] and [[hip hop]] fashion.

title: nagae_iku
body:
The "Beautiful Scarlet Cloth". Sub-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]][/i] and playable character in that and [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]].

A celestial and messenger of the Dragon Palace who came to [[Gensokyo]] to warn its citizens of a massive earthquake, having the ability to read the atmosphere. She uses her [[hagoromo]] as a weapon (most notably as a [[drill]]), but is best remembered for her spellcard activation pose, which is similar to that used by [[John Travolta]] in the film [[Saturday Night Fever]] or [[Great Mazinger_(robot)|Great Mazinger's]] Thunder Break. Hinted to be a nanny figure to [[Hinanawi Tenshi]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Iku Nagae":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Iku_Nagae

body:
When a character's eyebrows are elevated from the usual resting position.

Use [[raised inner eyebrows]] instead when only the inner ends are raised, while the outer ends remain lowered.

Use [[v-shaped eyebrows]] instead when only the outer ends are raised, while the inner ends point downwards in a V shape.

title: list_of_flower_knight_girl_characters
body:
This is an alphabetical list of all tagged characters in [[DMM]]'s online browser game [[Flower Knight Girl]]. The player commands an army comprising of female [[personification|personifications]] of various [[flower|flowers]] and angiosperm plants to do battle against insects.

The Japanese names for flowers (and some genus names as well) are used on Danbooru rather than the English, when applicable. The English names are listed in each character's wiki, as well as Nutaku's official name for the character when applicable. Some characters will have a known official artist linked in their wiki as well. Characters with 10+ posts are highlighted in [i]italic[/i]. Characters with 50+ posts are highlighted in [b]bold[/b].

h4. Characters

title: suzuya_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Suzuya (Kancolle)|]]'s Kai Ni form comes in two types: aviation heavy cruiser and light aircraft carrier.

On her second remodel, the uniform is replaced by a open brown [[cardigan]] with a lighter brown vest, and now the [[flight deck]] is the one having a strap, being carried like a shoulder bag. Her damaged portrait shows her wearing a [[purple bra]].

Her third remodel - a light carrier version - replaces her turret with a crossbow and her flight deck is much larger. This requires an additional blueprint since this is a hypothetical remodel based on the [[Ibuki (Azur Lane)|]]'s real-life conversion from CA to CVL (as Ibuki shared a largely identical hull to the Mogami-class.)

h4. Appearance

* !post #2681932: Second remodel
* !post #2681945: Third remodel
* !post #4311200: [[Suzuya Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

title: suzutsuki_(beachside_attendant!)_(azur_lane)
body:
The [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s [[Suzutsuki (azur lane)|]], as seen in post #4107049. 

Her swimsuit consists of a [[black bikini]] worn with a [[see-through shawl|see-through]] [[white shawl]], plus [[blue-tinted eyewear|blue-colored]] [[aviator sunglasses]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Suzutsuki (Swimsuit) (kancolle)|]] ([[Suzutsuki (Kancolle)]])

title: yura_(swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Yura (kancolle)|]]. 

She wears a [[white bikini]] under a [[black shirt]] and [[blue sarong]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]], an ankle strap containing a twin 610 mm [[torpedo launcher]], and a [[chain bracelet]]. Like [[Haruna (Kancolle)|]]'s swimsuit, the bikini isn't actually revealed until she is at least moderately damaged.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4681913: Without shirt

title: makigumo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Makigumo (Kancolle)|]]. 

Her winter version consists of a grey [[blazer]] over the standard Yuugumo-class uniform which now has a sheer black underskirt and her pantyhose being reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. Her hairstyle gains a [[crown braid]]. Distinctly though, her blazer has absurdly long sleeves like in her base form which cover her hands upon damage. However, while undamaged, said sleeves are folded just high up enough to expose her hands.

She later gets the summer variant: a violet [[vest]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned thighhighs. This however means that her hands are fully exposed in this uniform.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3319127: Winter
* !post #4645614: Summer
* !post #4037934: [[Makigumo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

h4. See also

h6. 10th Destroyer Division - kai ni

* [[Akigumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Akigumo]]
* [[Yuugumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Yuugumo]]
* [b]Makigumo[/b]
* [[Kazagumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kazagumo]]

title: kazagumo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Kazagumo (Kancolle)|]] in [[Kantai Collection]].

The winter uniform consists of a short grey [[blazer]] over a [[dress]] with a sheer black underskirt. Her [[pantyhose]] has also been reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. Because she wears a [[necktie]] on her base form rather than a large bowtie like her sisters do, she accordingly switches to an [[ascot]] to match her remodel. On her damaged CG, one can still see a [[camisole]] undernath, implying she does not gain even a slightly larger bustline with the remodel, unlike even [[Makigumo Kai Ni (kancolle)|]], who now wears a bra on remodel.

The summer uniform consists of a grey and violet [[vest]] (its two tones being full view due to her keeping the ascot) over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned thighhighs.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3410012: Winter
* !post #4645622: Summer
* !post #4026088: [[Kazagumo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

h4. 10th Destroyer Division - Kai Ni

* [[Akigumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Yuugumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Makigumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Kazagumo[/b]

title: pola_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian heavy cruiser [i]Pola[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Akasaki Chinatsu]].

She has [[grey_hair|gray]] [[wavy hair]], grayish [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a black [[bodice]] over a [[white shirt]], [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]] with [[anchor|anchors]] attached, [[red bowtie]], [[white hat|white]] [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life fire-control director, [[white thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is just like her sister [[Zara (Kancolle)|]]'s: two hull pieces containing her four 203 mm twin gun mounts. 

She is often portrayed [[drunk]] or as a heavy [[wine]] drinker. This is in reference to her sinking, when her surviving crew were rescued intoxicated.

title: langley_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Langley[/i] (CVL-27).

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair ornament]]s that represent her real-life hull blisters, a blue [[hair ribbon]], [[blue eyes]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]], [[pencil skirt]] with [[side slit]] and her hull number, [[garter straps]], and [[rudder footwear|rudder-propeller]] [[thighhighs]]. She also wields a [[Winchester Model 1897]] [[shotgun]].

She starts out as her original US Navy [i]Independence[/i]-class form, with her [[rigging]] consisting of her real-life flight deck split in two, a catapult, her two funnels at the back and her 76 mm AA single mounts. Her kai form add her hull number to her now combined flight deck and SK [[radar]] to her right, while her funnels are reduced to two and her 76 mm AA single mounts are replaced by two 40 mm quad AA mounts. Her rifle now also has a [[bayonet]] attached.

She was transferred to France in the post-war period as [i]La Fayette[/i], named in honor of the [[Marquis de La Fayette]].

Character design by [[Zeco]].

title: sendai_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Sendai[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] done [[two side up]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: an [[orange shirt]] with [[white sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels on her ankles, 14 cm gun mounts on both of her elbow gloves (with an additional [[aircraft catapult]] on her right), and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] attached to her [[black belt]]. 

She seems obsessed with night battles, on account of her historical battle record. Her obsession is so strong that she is also known as the "[[Night Battle Idiot]]" in-game. The phrase "night battle" is often used as a [[euphemism]] for [[sex]] in KanColle fan works. Her name can also be read as "Kawauchi", which is sometimes used to refer to her in a teasing way.

title: kamikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [i]Kamikaze[/i], lead ship of the [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class destroyers. Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], reddish-[[purple hair]] which [[gradient_hair| gradually fades]] to [[pink hair|pink]] at the ends, tied with a [[yellow ribbon]]. 

Kamikaze and her sisters wear traditional [[Japanese clothes]], namely a [[pink hakama]] over a [[red kimono]] paired with [[lace-up boots]] in the style of a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]], in reference to how she and her sisters were built during the [[Taishou]] era (when this style of dress was still common).

She doesn't want to be seen as old, despite being of the oldest destroyer class in the game and her old-fashioned looks. That being said, she has an excellent war record for her capabilities.

Kamikaze is related in some way to all four of the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class:

* She was part of Destroyer Division 1, which was part of the 5th fleet, led by [[nachi (kancolle)|Nachi]] during the battle of Attu.
* She was under the command of [[haguro (kancolle)|Haguro]] (and protected by her) during the Battle of Malacca Strait. Kamikaze saved some of Haguro's survivors after the battle.
* She was under [[Ashigara (kancolle)|Ashigara]]'s command until her sinking and also saved some of her survivors.
* She surrendered along with the crippled [[myoukou (kancolle)|Myoukou]] (and Takao) at Singapore.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]].

She has no relation to the [[kamikaze pilot]]s who conducted suicide attacks on Allied ships later in World War II.

h4. Appearance

title: kiyoshimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kiyoshimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[grey hair|grey]] outer, [[blue hair|blue]] inner) with a [[single hair bun]] turning into [[low twintails]], an [[ahoge]], a strand of hair passing [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]; and [[grey eyes]]. 

She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]]: a purple/maroon [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]], [[grey pantyhose|grey]]/[[purple pantyhose|purple]] opaque [[pantyhose]] and [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

h4. Skins

* !post #2441828: Base and kai
* !post #6765936: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] - Anti-air
* !post #6765937: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] - Anti-submarine
* !post #7777368: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]] (with parka)
* !post #7914298: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]] (without parka)
* !post #2248962: Setsubun mode
* !post #3917070: Tsuyu mode
* !post #6399017: Casual

h4. Personality
An excitable girl, she wants to become a battleship due to her admiration of the battleship [[musashi (kancolle)|Musashi]]. So, it is not uncommon to draw her with Musashi's (or another battleship's) rigging, if only to collapse under the weight.

body:
The second remodel of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Kiyoshimo (Kancolle)|]]. 

She wears a variant of the class' kai-ni uniform: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[grey jacket|grey]] [[collared jacket]] over the usual [[purple dress]], [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[high heels|high-heel]] [[lace-up boots]], but now sports black [[partially fingerless gloves]] and [[grey thighhighs]] instead of pantyhose. 

Her [[rigging]] remains identical, differing only in that instead of two quad [[torpedo tubes]], she now only has one: the other is replaced with [[depth charge]]s. She also gains an additional 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] (or depth charges in ASW form) on her left collar.

title: washington_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s [[personification]] of the USS [i]Washington[/i] (BB-56). Character design by [[Zeco]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with an [[ahoge]] as well as [[grey eyes]] and [[headgear]] jutting out from the sides of her head. 

Her default outfit is a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]] under a [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]] that exposes her [[bare shoulders]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]] with shin guards. Her [[rigging]] includes her famed nine 16-inch (406 mm)/45-caliber Mark 6 guns, plus additional 12.7 cm twin gun mounts at kai form.

She is usually depicted with [[South Dakota (kancolle)|]], oftentimes at odds with each other, a reflection of the rivalry the crews of the two historical battleships had. The rivalry stems from ill feelings by [i]South Dakota[/i]'s crew who mistakenly thought they were bait for [i]Washington[/i]'s attack in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal where she severely damaged and sank [[Kirishima (Kancolle)|]] and [[Ayanami (Kancolle)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: kiso_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kiso[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears an [[eyepatch]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sisters Kuma and Tama, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[white hat]], [[white skirt]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and funnels to her back, a 14 cm gun mount on her left, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to a [[brown belt]]. 

Bears a resemblance to [[Murasa Minamitsu]] on account of her artist having done Touhou arts prior to Kancolle.

title: isuzu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Isuzu[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue_hair|dark blue hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sisters Nagara and Natori: a [[white shirt]] with a [[brown sailor collar]] and [[detached sleeves]], white [[hair bow]]s for her twintails, [[brown neckerchief]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels to her back, connecting platforms that have her 12.7 cm twin gun mounts, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]], and a [[searchlight]] and 12.7 cm twin gun mount on a [[bullpup]] stock. 

Initially infamous for her low remodeling level (12), she became valuable for farming, which can give you a radar and enhanced AA stats if used as modernization fodder.

title: umikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Umikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Ishigami Shizuka]].

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white hair]] tied in a single [[braid]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her left eye]]. Her default outfit is a modified version of the class' [[black serafuku]] with [[detached sleeves]], featuring a large white stripe on the front of the blouse, [[blue neckerchief]], [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[mary janes]]. 

She has a serious and eager personality, and tends to worry over her sister-ship, [[Kawakaze (Kancolle)|]].

title: noshiro_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Noshiro[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] in [[twin braids]], and [[blue eyes|blue]]/[[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is her class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], dark [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[asymmetrical legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, two hull pieces containing her three real-life 15.2 twin gun mounts with a [[joystick]] control, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right [[rudder footwear|rudder boot]], and her [[flight deck]] on the left boot.

body:

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit at base form is a one-piece [[black dress]] [[school uniform]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[mechanical halo]], and uses a [[glaive (polearm)|]] as her sidearm. 

Depicted as a foil to her sister [[Tenryuu (Kancolle)|]], she has a demure yet somewhat sadistic personality.

title: executor_(arknights)
body:
[i]Executor, a professional undertaker sent from the Laterano Embassy, is glad to fulfill any and all contracts[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Federico Giallo

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]181 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A lawyer from the Laterano Notarial Hall, he came to Rhodes Island along with [[Vermeil_(arknights)|Vermeil]] in order to fulfill his client's last wish to give Vermeil treatment for her oripathy. He himself has been contracted to Rhodes Island, where he executes functions related to the rights of Laterano citizens. His main weapon is a shotgun, most likely based on a [[Winchester Model 1887]].

Due to the way he speaks and his behavior, many of his colleagues are convinced he is just a robot disguised as a living person.

As a Sankta, his motif is an angel. He has a black halo above his head and crystallized black "wings" coming out of his back.

He is voiced by Takashi Kondou.

h4. Skins

* !post #3897772: Elite II

* !post #8413575: [[executor the ex foedere (allmind as one) (arknights)|Allmind as One]]

title: suzutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]]/[[grey hair]] tied [[one side up]] with a [[hachimaki]] and fire control director, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[white bodysuit]], [[grey jacket]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (suzutsuki's)|]]. Upon remodel her [[hachimaki]] becomes white, the writing changes from "61st Destroyer Division" to "41st Destroyer Division", and her Chou-10cm-hou-chan gains a set of 25mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2929942: Base (DesDiv61)
* !post #2929949: Kai (DesDiv41)

title: kasumi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kasumi[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[side ponytail]], [[yellow_eyes|yellowish]]-[[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]].

She is notorious as the worst verbally abusive shipgirl. Yes, she is even more foul-mouthed than [[akebono (kancolle)|Akebono]]. She often treats her [[admiral (kancolle)|Admiral]] as a dumb servant and is constantly hardheaded and irritated. However this only hides her [[tsundere|feelings]] especially when you marry her; she gets flustered more often.

title: tenryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Tenryuu[/i]. Character designed by [[Ayaki]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[large breasts]], and an [[eyepatch]] covering her left eye. Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], checkered [[black necktie]], [[black jacket]]/[[cardigan]], [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]], and [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is semi-futuristic in theme and consists of her real-life bridge to her back with two 14 cm single gun mounts, and floating [[headgear]]. 

Depicted with a tough girl personality with the catchphrase of "Heh, you scared?"; she is, however, often depicted in a way that subverts this generally because her stats are very sub-par for her ship type and is generally used as expedition fleet fodder rather than part of a combat fleet. She is also depicted as a babysitter to the destroyers due to her low fuel cost.

h4. Appearance

body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German destroyer Z3 [i]Max Schultz[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Z1, consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[sailor hat]] with her name on it, a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue sailor collar|sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], dark [[blue socks]], and [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, connecting two hull pieces that have her 12.8 cm single gun mounts and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], as well as a third 12.8 cm twin [[handgun]] mount.

Born in Londinium in Victoria, Hibiscus is the older twin sister of her fellow Operator, [[Lava (Arknights)|]]. After contracting Oripathy, she came to Rhodes Island for treatment. Her passion for caring for others, as well as her hard work, have led her to become a Rhodes Island Medic.

Member of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1, along with [[Fang (Arknights)|]], [[Beagle (Arknights)|]], [[Kroos (Arknights)|]] and her younger sister, Lava.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Iguchi Yuka]].

title: hakos_baelz
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]], designed by [[Mika Pikazo]].

The leader of holoCouncil, she's the embodiment of chaos who manifests as a [[mouse girl|rat girl]] to signify her power.

She has [[mouse ears]] and a [[mouse tail|tail]] with a [[tail bow]]. Her hair is mostly [[red hair|red]] with [[streaked hair|streaks]] of [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair|white]] and black [[colored tips]], she also has [[blue eyes]] with red highlights and [[medium breasts]] (although artists often [[alternate breast size|depict them in varying sizes]]).

Her default hairstyle is [[uneven twintails]] tied with [[dice hair ornament]]s and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].
