title: weedy_(arknights)
body:
[i]Weedy, a researcher in Rhodes Island's Bioengineering Department, has set foot on the battlefield after completing her studies.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Iberia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 23[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A bioengineering expert who was born into a family of Iberian scientists, is a researcher who has been with Rhodes Island since its establishment. She has chosen to become an operator of her own free will, providing long-ranged support to other operators on the battlefield.

A neat-freak in nature, she regularly nags fellow engineer [[Closure (Arknights)|]] regarding her sloppy lifestyle, and collaborates with [[Glaucus (Arknights)|]] on various projects and research works. Also possesses a bionic seadragon named [[Leaf (Arknights)|]].

Uses and deploys water cannons during combat. Her motif and callsign is based from [i]Weedy[/i] seadragons.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Naganawa Maria]].

title: lava_(arknights)
body:

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Born in Londinium in Victoria, Lava is the younger twin sister of her fellow Operator, [[Hibiscus (Arknights)|]]. After contracting Oripathy, she came to Rhodes Island for treatment. She found the idea of saving lives appealing, and so volunteered for training. Lava is tough and ignores the advice of others when she moves into action. She is gentle and childlike at heart but prefers not to admit it to herself. Whenever anyone brings this up, she immediately changes the subject and tries to play it cool.

Member of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1, along with [[Fang (Arknights)|]], [[Beagle (Arknights)|]], [[Kroos (Arknights)|]] and her older sister, Hibiscus.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].

She is also the second of the Silverash siblings, being the older sister of [[cliffheart_(arknights)|Encia "Cliffheart" Silverash]] and the younger sister of [[silverash_(arknights)|Enciodas Silverash]]. How she came to Rhodes Island and her employment by them is confidential.

Despite her stature, she is quite a lazy bum and always slacking off, given any chance.

Just like her siblings, her motif is based on the snow leopard.

title: gotoh_hitori
body:
Main character in [[Bocchi the Rock!]]. Also known by her titular nickname "Bocchi", an introverted girl with an exceptional skill at playing [[guitar]]. She struggled to find any friends due to her social anxiety until she joined the Kessoku Band at the request of [[Ijichi Nijika]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[one side up]], [[large breasts]] (according to ch. 4 of the manga)  & [[hair between eyes]] (sometimes depicted with [[hair over eyes]]). She usually wears a [[cube hair ornament]], a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[track jacket]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Other times depicted wearing [[pink pants|pink]] [[track pants|track]] [[pants under skirt|pants under her skirt]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] the [[Gibson Les Paul]] [[Electric Guitar]], which she is usually depicted [[holding instrument|holding]] or keeping in [[instrument case|guitar case]].

She is voiced by [[Aoyama Yoshino]] and portrayed by [[Morino Mamo]] in the stage-play.

Not to be confused with [[Hitori Bocchi]] from [i][[Hitoribocchi no Marumaru Seikatsu]][/i].

h4. See also
* [[Gotoh Hitori (tsuchinoko)]]
* [[Gotoh Hitori (octopus)]]
* "Bocchi's Stress-induced Transformations":[/pools/20401]

title: saileach_(arknights)
body:
[i]Standard-bearer Saileach has come to Rhodes Island from County Hillock.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Jane "Janie" Willow

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 31[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former Victorian ceremonial standard bearer, she served at the Victorian Army Barracks in County Hillock, where the head of the local Rhodes Island branch office presented her as a liaison operator. She has basic Victorian Army training under her belt, superior physical ability, and demonstrated a talent for support operations. Peers regard her as compassionate, friendly, carries herself with due elegance, idealistic and an extraordinary cook; generally regarded by the fandom as the game's take on the [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] archetype.

Her callsign is the Irish term for her surname, [i]willow[/i]. Her [[saileach (elite ii) (arknights)|second promotion]] art depicts a [[naga]] in reference to her Sargonian lineage. Uses a [[rapier]] and a blue-and-yellow Victorian banner in battle.

One of the main characters of the story [i]Episode 9: Stormwatch[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Tomatsu Haruka]] (Japanese), Yuan Weng (Chinese), Meaghan Martin (English), and Kim Sun-hye (Korean). Her art designer is [[Xiayehongming]].

Real Name: Adele Naumann

A world renowned volcanologist and catastrophe messenger from Leithanien. She is exceptionally talented in the use of advanced Originium techniques and high-energy Arts. Her Oripathy is quite severe, which has made her nearly deaf. She is currently undergoing treatment at Rhodes Island, while providing support in Catastrophe research, environmental observation/assessment, assistance in traversing dangerous terrain, among others. She is the daughter of [[Katia Naumann]] (father) and [[Magna Naumann]] (mother).

Her motif is based on sheep. Her callsign is a reference to the Icelandic volcano [i]Eyjafjallajökull[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Taneda Risa]].

title: tsushima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Tsushima[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]], voiced by [[Imamura Ayaka]] (initial) and [[Seto Asami]] (after Imamura's retirement). 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient_hair|gradient]], and [[two-tone eyes|two-tone]] [[purple eyes|purple]]-[[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Etorofu[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[blue sailor collar]], [[aqua neckerchief]], [[white hat|white]] [[beret]], [[white gloves]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, additional depth charges slung to her side, and a [[blue ribbon|blue]] ankle ribbon.

As a coastal defense ship, her class is even smaller than destroyers, and as such, she is portrayed as an "elementary school student" character, even younger than the generally "middle school" appearances of the destroyers. She comes off as having a cool personality.

The seventh member of the class, she was transferred to Taiwan post-war as ROCS [i]Lin An[/i], serving until 1963. She is named after "Tsushima Island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsushima_Island]  at the Korea Strait between South Korea and Japan. The island is also known as Daemado (대마도) as Changwon City, South Korea "lays claim to the island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_claim_to_Tsushima_Island], but not South Korea itself.

title: mutsu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] obtained her second remodel with the 27 February 2019 update.

She obtained a new outfit similar to [[Nagato Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Nagato]] before her, the differences (outside of color) being a v-neck instead of a [[turtleneck]] and draped half-sleeves + short gloves instead of short sleeves ending in long gloves. body:
An android representing the [[Parker-Hale IDW]] (Individual Defense Weapon) in [[Girls' Frontline]]. 

Due to a combination of her particularly annoying voice, her status as a common rarity weapon, and her sharing the same production time as the more desirable Grizzly MkV, she has a knack for appearing when the player least desires her, which is quite frequently.

Would receive a [[IDW (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], IDW appears as [[Betty (neural cloud)|]].

title: kitakami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kitakami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with the back in a long [[braid]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her base outfit, shared with her sister [[Ooi (Kancolle)|]], is composed of a [[green shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]] with white stripes, and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her base [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, a 14 cm [[handgun]] mount, and twin 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] on her left arm.

Her personality goes all over the place. Sometimes, she's a genuinely nice girl; other times, "she trolls":/pools/7431 [[Abukuma (Kancolle)|]]. She often expresses her annoyance with the destroyers. She is likes to boast of her abilities, such as referring herself as "Super Kitakami-sama" after remodeling.

The nature of her relationship with [[Ooi (Kancolle)|]] varies but they are usually very close to each other. In some versions, Kitakami is straight while Ooi is a lesbian, and Kitakami has to repeatedly shred Ooi's delusions. In others, they're a romantic couple. In yet further versions, they're both bisexual and have eyes for the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] and each other.

title: tan_yang_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] kai form, after being transferred to the Republic of China ([[Taiwan]]).

She wears a [[red shirt|red]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar|grey]] [[sailor collar]] and [[brown neckerchief]] over a [[white dress|white]] stylized [[china dress]]. She wears more modernized communications [[headgear]] and dual-anchor [[hairclip]]s (which are miniature versions of the ROC Navy emblem) and sports [[machinery]] which includes Type 89 12.7 cm/40 dual mounted guns as well as new Taiwanese weapons due to the ROC Navy having no access to the original Japanese armaments. Her [[rudder footwear|rudder boots]] sport the number 12, in reference to her new hull number DD-12. Noticeable immediately is that Tan Yang dresses more conservatively with a slightly longer dress compared to either Yukikaze in base form or in her official second remodel.

Her name can also be romanized as "Danyang" in Hanyu Pinyin instead of Wade-Giles. The game officially uses the Hanyu Pinyin romanization, but the Wade-Giles one is used here for historical reasons as well as the tendency for Taiwanese to shun the mainland-formulated Pinyin.

Even before she was added to the game, some fan artists had already created their own versions of Tan Yang, either through [[original remodel (kantai collection)|]]s, mere associations with Taiwan, or juxtapositions with anything vaguely Chinese in general, [[AceA4]] being one prominent example.

title: iowa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Iowa[/i] (BB-61). Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Hashimoto Chinami (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], grayish [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]] with visible [[cleavage]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey corset]] with her real-life hull number printed on it, [[blue shirt]] tied to the front, [[American flag print]] [[thighhighs]] (red vertical stripes for the right, blue for the left), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], two-tone grey-blue [[miniskirt]], [[black belt]] with the US Navy emblem, and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces containing her three historic three 406 mm/16-inch triple mounts Mk7, one to her left and two to her right. She also carries three of her ten 127 mm twin mounts: one beside the starboard main guns, two to the back of the portside main gun. Her funnel carries searchlights on either side and has two Bofors 40 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s below the searchlights. Another Bofors quad mount is atop her third main battery turret, while the second turret has three Oerlikon 20mm mounts on its top. 

Much like [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], Iowa is loud, friendly and energetic. Also like Kongou, she uses English mixed in with her Japanese speech, but her English is so broken and accented many find it incomprehensible.

Her historical counterpart is currently docked in the Port of Los Angeles complex as a museum ship, making her the first ship to appear in the game which wasn't sunk, scuttled, scrapped, or expended as a target. She is also the first Allied ship implemented in the game.

title: ki-44_shouki
body: The [b]Nakajima Ki-44 Shoki[/b] (鍾馗, "Devil Queller") was a single-seat fighter-interceptor which was developed by the Nakajima Aircraft Company and operated by the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] from 1942 to 1945 during World War II.

title: kamoi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese seaplane tender [i]Kamoi[/i]. Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]], voiced by [[Seto Asami]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[white_hair|white]] on the outside, [[blue_hair|blue]] on the inside and the eyebrows) and tied to a [[folded ponytail]] with a [i]matanpus[/i] [[headband]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Each of her forms has her wear some variant of a blue [[cropped jacket]] over a long, [[sleeveless_dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] with [[thighhighs]]. In her base form her thighhighs are black bandages. In her [[Kamoi Kai (kancolle)|Kai]] form she wears [[thigh boots]]. In [[Kamoi Kai Bo (kancolle)|Kai Bo]] form her headband loses its pattern.

She was one of a few Japanese ships in-game to be built abroad (besides [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]]). In her case, at New York Shipbuilding Corporation, at the same time as [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]], before her conversion (for this reason, [i]she[/i] is the key for building Saratoga with LSC). However, she shows very little traces of her birthland and instead acts as the token minority of the fleet. Her design is heavily influenced by the [[Ainu]], featuring distinctive patterning as well as a [[ainu_clothes|few clothing items]] and objects. 

She is the only ship in the game to change ship class three times as well as the only ship who irreversibly (but nominally) return to their original ship class. As Kai Bo, she is the only other ship other than [[akitsushima (kancolle)|Akitsushima]] to field Flying Boats.

title: nagato_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Nagato[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[Japanese clothes|Japanese-style]] [[midriff]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black corset]] with a [[gold trim]], [[black_gloves|black]] [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] with black trim, grey waist piece with a [[kikumon]] (based off her bow), [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two connected hull pieces in a half-circle, fastened to her back with a funnel and containing her four 41 cm twin gun mounts and two 14 cm single mounts. 

Often portrayed as cool and professional if a bit prideful, being one (and the first) of the Big 7 battleships legally allowed by the Washington Naval Treaty system to mount 16-inch guns. Secretly likes cute things.

In real life, she was [[Yamamoto Isoroku]]'s flagship in the first months of the war (even gave the signal for the Pearl Harbor attack to commence from her bridge). She served as part of BatDiv1 with [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] and [[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] in the [[battle of Midway]]. After the war, she was used along with [[sakawa (kancolle)|Sakawa]], [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]] and [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]] as a target at Bikini Atoll during [[Operation Crossroads]]. She was sunk after the Baker test from a combination of damage sustained on the attack on Yokosuka and the two nuclear tests.

A magical girl (魔法少女, [i]mahou shoujo[/i]) is a young girl with magical abilities, typically being chosen to fight evil and to protect the Earth by a "mascot" familiar. They often possess a secret identity they [[transformation|transform]] into through a [[henshin]] sequence, although the name can just refer to young girls who follow a plotline involving magic and a transformation.

On Danbooru this tag is used for characters dressed in a magical girl outfit.

title: sten_gun
body:
The [b]STEN[/b] (or [b]Sten gun[/b]) was a family of blowback operated, open bolt 9×19mm [[submachine gun]]s, used by [[united kingdom|British]] and Commonwealth forces throughout [[World War II]] since 1941 and the [[Korean War]]. They were notable for having a simple design and very low production cost, making them effective insurgency [[weapon]]s for resistance groups. Sten's overall appearance resembles a metal tube with a side-mounted [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] insertion on the left side.

The acronym "STEN" originated from the names of the [[weapon]]'s chief designers - Major Reginald V. [b]S[/b]hepherd, Harold [b]T[/b]urpin and [b]En[/b]field. Sten guns were produced in several basic marks, one of the most common one is the Mk II. 

h4. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MP 3008]]
* [[Sten MkII (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[Sterling SMG]]

title: sauron
body:
One of the main antagonists in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

He was a Maia, an [[angel]]ic being in the Legendarium, who was corrupted by [[Morgoth]] and became a Dark Lord bent on controlling the world of Middle-earth. He is the main antagonist of [[The Lord of the Rings]] trilogy and was ultimately defeated after the destruction of [[the One Ring]].

He took on many forms with many names throughout his existence:

* Mairon, his original Maia name
* Annatar, a persona he took on to deceive the Elves into forging the Rings of Power
* [[Eye of Sauron]], a symbol of Sauron

title: chemise
body:
A chemise is essentially a [[camisole|camisole]] that ends past the waist. Usually worn as an undergarment.

In modern usage, a chemise is generally a woman's garment that vaguely resembles the older shirts but is typically more delicate, and usually provocative. Most commonly the term refers to a loose-fitting, sleeveless undergarment or type of [[lingerie]] which is unfitted at the waist. It can also refer to a short, sleeveless dress that hangs straight from the shoulders and fits loosely at the waist. A chemise typically does not have any buttons or other fasteners and is put on by either dropping it over the head or stepping into it and lifting it up. Its usually on the plainer side, being worn under clothes to smoothe the silhouette. 

As lingerie, a chemise is similar to a [[babydoll]], which is also a short, loose-fitting, sleeveless garment. Typically, though, babydolls are more loose-fitting at the hips and are generally designed to more resemble a young girl's [[nightgown]], although many modern styles have added various sexualizing features. Babydolls also have an [[empire waist]], which chemises do not.

title: sopralto
body:
Sopralto also known as Moru Onpu is a female American/Vietnamese Independent VTuber who streams on Twitch.

h4. Profile

Sopralto (a.k.a. Soppy) is an average guinea pig by day and a [[magical girl]] by night. Originally, she was just a humble class pet, but one night she wished to be able to communicate with her beloved classroom children. The next day she woke up from her sleep to see she was no longer just a guinea pig, but now a guinea pig girl. She now spends her days eating the lettuce her students give her and vows to do whatever it takes to keep them happy. Being introduced to streaming by one of the kids, she now streams in her free time to fuel her lettuce addiction.

title: heavy_gundam
body:
A fictional giant manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]FA-78-2 Heavy Gundam[/b]

The evolution of the [[Heavy Full Armor Gundam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], it had much beefier armor built into the unit as opposed to added on top, more powerful thrusters, which remedied the FA-78-1's horrid maneuverability, and omitted the Core Block System for more armor. It also received a new weapon system, the Frame Launcher, which mounted a huge Gatling gun and missile launchers. The shoulder launched rocket launcher of the FA Gundam was replaced with a much more powerful beam cannon.

title: rick_dom
body:
[b]MS-09R Rick Dom[/b]

A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

The Rick Dom is a variant of the MS-09B [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] made for [[space]] combat. It retains its parent design's tough armor and cross-shaped visor, while integrating multiple added [[thrusters]] in its redesigned legs for excellent mobility in space.

h4. See also
* [[Rick Dias]]

title: black_speech_(language)
body: One of the languages constructed by J. R. R. Tolkien for his [[Tolkien's legendarium|legendarium]]. Itself a constructed langauage in-universe, it was created by [[Sauron]] to serve as the language of his forces in [[Mordor]]. Tolkien seldom wrote about the Black Speech, and it is best known for being the language inscribed on the [[The One Ring|One Ring]], written in a stylized [[Tengwar text|Tengwar]] script.

title: tequila_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard Operator Tequila, all smiles on the battlefield too.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real Name: Ernesto Salas

The son of Bolívarian militant [[Pancho Salas (arknights)|]], and [[La Pluma (arknights)|]]'s brother. The former director of the International Trade Management Department of Dossoles.

After the incident in Dossoles City, he joined Rhodes Island under the recommendation of [[Ch'en (arknights)|]].

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i].

His motif is based on the golden retriever.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]] (Japanese), Zhengwu Wenjie (Chinese), and Kim Sin-woo (Korean). His art designer is [[Kang Yiqian (self cultivation)|]].

title: maruyama_hiroshi

He originally worked for [[Tsuburaya Productions]], as he did most of the character designs for the [[Ultra Series]], mainly in the Heisei era, from [[Ultraman Tiga|Tiga]] to [[Ultraman Mebius|Mebius]].

After stepping down as the main character designer for the Ultra Series, as well as departing from the company, he then did the creature designs for the [[Battle Spirits]] franchise, as well as the character designs of the [[Phantom (Kamen Rider Wizard)|Phantoms]] from [[Kamen Rider Wizard (series)|]].

She wears a [[white one-piece swimsuit|white]] [[frilled_swimsuit|frilled]] [[casual_one-piece_swimsuit|casual one-piece]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg swimsuit]] with a [[criss-cross halter]], [[side-tie_swimsuit|tied on the sides]] and held with small [[anchor]]s, initially under a frilled turtleneck side-tie shirt which disappears in Kai form. Optional are a [[white choker]], a [[hairband]] [[hair_flower|adorned with white flowers]], a pair of [[earrings]] apparently shaped like [[lemon slice]]s, a long [[white shawl]], and [[sandals]]. The apparent skimpiness of the swimsuit, especially the Kai form, has in some way provided a minor popularity boost to one of the more forgotten Ayanami sisters.

Also became a [[sagiri_(kancolle)_(cosplay)|popular cosplay item]] upon implementation, thus giving it the [i]rei no mizugi[/i] (例の水着; i.e. "[i]that[/i] swimsuit") tag.

h4. Appearance
* !post #5507429: Base
* !post #5505179: Kai

title: trucy_wright
body:
The 15-year old adopted daughter of [[Phoenix Wright]], and works as [[Apollo Justice]]'s co-counsel. She is a magician with numerous tricks at her disposal. [spoiler]Her real parents are [[Zak Gramarye]] and [[Lamiroir (ace attorney)|Thalassa Gramarye]].[/spoiler]

Trucy has [[low-tied long hair|low tied long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and an [[antenna hair|antenna]] that often appears [[short hair|short]] when viewed from the front and [[blue eyes]]. 

Trucy's [[magician]] outfit consists of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[top hat]], a [[single earring|single]] golden [[diamond earrings|diamond]] [[earrings|earring]], a [[red scarf]] on her neck, a [[blue cape|blue]] [[cape]] with a [[green gemstone]] [[brooch]] and a [[print cape|print]] consisting of card suits - [[spade (shape)|spades]], [[heart]]s, [[diamond (shape)|diamonds]] and [[club (shape)|clubs]], a [[short dress|short]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress|black]] [[dress]] with [[diamond button|diamond]] [[buttons]], a [[belt pouch]], a pair of [[white gloves]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Naruhodou Minuki

title: ema_skye
body:
A detective and forensics "expert" despite not passing her forensics exams. [[Phoenix Wright]] helped her out in a past case, so she repays the favor by helping [[Apollo Justice]] and [[Trucy Wright]] in their cases. Skye loves snacks, and gets annoyed easily. Her snack of choice is [[karintou]] (localized as snackoos).

She has [[green eyes|green]]/[[aqua eyes|aqua]] eyes and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. When she was 16, she had it tied into a [[topknot]], but as she got older, she switched to a [[half updo]], instead.

Her outfits vary game-by-game, but all of them share a pair of [[white-framed eyewear|white-framed]]-and-[[pink-tinted eyewear|pink]] glasses [[eyewear on head|on her head]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]], a [[white coat|white]] [[open coat|open]] [[coat]] with [[lapels]] and [[sleeves rolled up|rolled up sleeves]], a [[wristwatch]], a [[shoulder bag]] of sorts, and at least one [[button badge]].

In [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]], when she was 16, she wore a [[red bowtie|red]] [[bowtie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt|mini]][[skirt]], a [[pink bag|pink]] [[shoulder bag]] with [[vial]]s inside, a pair of [[red socks|red]] [[kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[loafers]].

In [[Ace Attorney Investigations]], when she was 18, she wore a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[cabbie hat]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[striped necktie|striped]] [[necktie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[black bag|black]] [[shoulder bag]], a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[brown shorts|brown]] [[shorts]], and a pair of [[black thighhighs|black]][[two-tone thighhighs|-and-]][[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|under]] a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced footwear|lace]][[lace-up boots|-up]] [[boots]].

In [[Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney]], when she was 25, she wore a [[red neckerchief|red]] [[neckerchief]], a [[green vest|green]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[red bag|red]] [[shoulder bag]] with [[vial]]s inside, a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[brown pants|brown]] [[capri pants|capri]] [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

In [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice]], when she was 27, she mostly reprised her outfit from AJ:AA, except she also wore a [[red armband|red]]/[[brown armband]] [[armband]] with a [[text print|text]] [[print armband]] noting her position in the police force.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8845946: [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]]
* !post #8845967: [[Ace Attorney Investigations]]
* !post #8845955: [[Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney]]
* !post #8845969: [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice]]


[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Houzuki Akane (宝月茜 / ほうづき あかね)

title: z1_leberecht_maass_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German destroyer Z1 [i]Leberecht Maass[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Z3, consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[sailor hat]] with her name on it, a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue sailor collar|sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], dark [[blue socks]], and [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, connecting two hull pieces that have her 12.8 cm single gun mounts and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], as well as a third 12.8 cm twin [[handgun]] mount.

She is often depicted as a [[otoko no ko]] in fanart due to her somewhat masculine voice and mannerisms along with her [[androgynous]] looks.

title: tanikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Tanikaze[/i], the fourteenth ship of the Kagerou-class destroyers.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[white hairband|white]] [[hairband]]. Like her division mates from the 17th Destroyer Division, she wears a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] and blue button-up [[serafuku]] with a yellow scarf (similar to [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]]) on top of a Kagerou-class standard [[pleated skirt]] along with [[white thighhighs]]. On her back is her [[rigging]], with an attached [[depth charge]]. Like most of the Kagerou-class, she wears [[white gloves]]. She [[dual wielding|dual wields]] two [[handgun]]s, one resembling the standard 12.7 cm twin gun, the other resembling an anti-air gun.

She speaks like a stereotypical [[Edoben|Edokko]] despite being built in Osaka. Thus, she is the opposite of [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]] (who speaks in [[Kansaiben]] but was built in Yokohama, just nearby Tokyo). Also, because of her accent, she has a good relationship with [[Suzukaze (kancolle)|]] who shares the same accent, and is sometimes shown sprouting [[Buront]]isms.

She is a frequent victim of [[breast envy]] due the fact that she is only one in 17th Destroyers Division who has a [[flat chest]] and is often compared with her sisters and division mates [[Urakaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hamakaze (kancolle)|]] who have [[large breasts]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24758453: Base
* !asset #24758483: [[Tanikaze D Kai (Kancolle)|D Kai]]
* !asset #24758456: [[Tanikaze (christmas) (kancolle)|Christmas]]

* "Kancolle Wiki: Tanikaze":https://en.kancollewiki.net/Tanikaze
* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer [i]Tanikaze[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Tanikaze_(1940)

title: biting_ear_for_good_luck
body:
A sort of trend that started in 2024, where allowing your girlfriend/boyfriend/whatever to [[biting ear|bite your ear]] may bring good luck. It also apparently applies to artists drawing the act.

May depict the act of [[biting ear]] or [[imminent bite|imminent biting]].

It may have started with "this tweet":https://twitter.com/kannkannna/status/1731996672807600503 of [[Kan Kanna]] and [[Tsukine Kona]] (asset #24838068). post #7159043 may be the first instance of this phenomenon drawn.

h4. External links
* "pixiv encyclopedia":https://dic.pixiv.net/a/耳噛み開運

title: unicron
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] franchise.

[b]Unicron[/b] is an evil, all powerful, massive and sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that transforms into a yellow and silver metallic [[planet]]. He is a god of evil, neither [[Autobot]] nor [[Decepticon]]. He is in a constant struggle against his benevolent brother [[Primus (transformers)|]]

Motto: [i]"That which does not become a part of the one... shall become one with the void!!!...".[/i]

h4.See also

* TFWiki: "Unicron":http://tfwiki.net/wiki/Unicron

title: steven_armstrong
body:
[b]Senator Steven Armstrong[/b] is the main antagonist of [i][[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]][/i].

An independent US Senator and presidential hopeful from Colorado, [spoiler]Armstrong runs World Marshall and is responsible for triggering the series of events of the game.[/spoiler] Before then, he had attended the University of Texas before joining the US Navy, though the details of his service record are unknown. His ultimate goal is to start a war between the US and Pakistan [spoiler]and use it as a means to win the Presidential elections and turn America into a Ultra-individualistic Social Darwinist state.[/spoiler]

His bombastic personality and raw physical prowess (having fought [[raiden_(metal_gear)|Raiden]] to a standstill) has lent itself to a number of notable [[meme]]s, most famously concerning the fact that he was [[nanomachines_son!_(meme)|at some point injected with nanomachines]] that harden in response to physical trauma.

h4. See also
* [[Raiden punching Armstrong (meme)]]
* [[Nanomachines son! (meme)]]

title: vergil_status_(meme)
body:
Recurring [[meme]] where [[Vergil (Devil May Cry)|]] from [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] interrupts (usually sensitive) content with Judgment Cut End while an unofficial edit of "Bury the Light" (more specifically the a capella "I am the storm that is approaching" chorus) plays in the background.

The meme itself an offshoot of a previous meme called "Revengeance Status" where the same sensitive content is also interrupted, but this time with a character from [[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]] (typically [[Steven Armstrong|Senator Armstrong]], Monsoon, or [[Samuel Rodrigues|Jetstream Sam]]).

title: yamato_(sword)
body: [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]]'s trademark dark-forged blade appearing in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. It is a legendary sword that was once wielded by his father [[Sparda]], and was left to Vergil as a keepsake. It resembles a Japanese [[katana|Ōkatana]] and is imbued with tremendous magic, being able to cut through anything.

title: laundry_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 2
[b]Attribute:[/b] Water
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can send the top 3 cards of your Deck to the GY. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Laundry Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1600

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Dragonmaid" archetype. Her dragon form is [[Dragonmaid Nudyarl]]. Can be easily distinguished by her blue/purple [[wa maid]] uniform.

As the youngest-looking member of the archetype (as well as her artwork), she is depicted as being childish and clumsy. She is also occasionally paired with [[Eldlich the Golden Lord]] in fanart due to a series of fanarts by [[Hatano Kiyoshi]] referring to her supposed synergy in Eldlich decks. She is also often paired with [[Parlor Dragonmaid]], who is often depicted as her "sister figure".

In fanart, Laundry Dragonmaid also has a rivalry with [[Tearlaments Merrli]] because both of them has the same "mill 3" effects that also synergizes with Tearlaments decks, albeit Laundry is deemed inferior due to her lacking built-in fusion ability that Merrli has. This trend in rivalry fanart shot up when Merlli got banned in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel]].
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ラドリー
ドラゴンメイド・フルス

title: cone_hair_bun
body:
Cone-shaped [[hair bun]]s. This includes both [[double bun]]s and [[single hair bun]]s.

Be careful not to confuse with [[hair horns]], [[hairpods]] (cone-shaped [[bun cover]]s), [[animal ears]], or the [[beehive hairdo]]. If a character's hair is tied so tightly that they resemble sharp horns ([[Mioda Ibuki]]), or their hair sticks up to form natural spikes ([[Marnie (pokemon)|]]), use [[hair horns]].

h4. Examples

title: house_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 9
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Dragonmaid" monster + 1 Dragon monster
Once per turn, during the Standby Phase: You can target 1 other "Dragonmaid" monster you control; Special Summon 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY in Defense Position, whose Level is 1 higher or 1 lower than it. When another face-up Dragon monster(s) you control returns to your hand (except during the Damage Step): You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy it.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2000


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]], a member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] in her dragon form. As indicated from her title, she is the Dragonmaid archetype's head maid.

Although House Dragonmaid has Light attribute, her maid uniform color is black, which is more likely Dark attribute monsters' color, this may due to her being inspired from a [[Victorian maid]].

House Dragonmaid is often depicted having a serious personality, she can get angry for [[Parlor Dragonmaid]] eating sweet sneakily or [[Laundry Dragonmaid]] doesn't have her laundry job done.

h4. See also

* [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] (dragon form)
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ハスキー
ドラゴンメイド・シュトラール

title: musashi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Musashi[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Misato (voice actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in [[two side up]] style and [[twintails]], [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes]], [[dark skin]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of chest [[bandages]] in a [[sarashi]] style, [[black cape|black]] [[capelet]] with a [[red sailor collar]], [[kikumon]] collar, [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. The only visible difference in her [[Musashi Kai (Kancolle)|kai form]] is that her red skirt and jacket/capelet turn black.

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces in a half-circle and held by a funnel to her back, containing her three 46 cm triple gun mounts and four 15.5 cm triple gun mounts (base) or two 15.5 plus six 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts (kai); [[thigh strap]]s with armor-piercing shells, and a headpiece based off her real-life rangefinder.

title: morgoth
body: In [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], [b]Morgoth[/b], meaning "Black Foe" or "Dark Enemy", was the name that the Elves gave to Melkor, the divine spirit that rebelled against the god Eru Iluvatar and became the original source of evil in the world. After his defeat, his role as Dark Lord was taken over by his trusted servant [[Sauron]].

title: vergil_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Alpha and the Omega, Vergil[/b]

Vergil is the older of the twin sons of [[Sparda]] and [[Eva (Devil May Cry)|]], and is the main antagonist of [[Devil May Cry 3]]. 
Unlike [[Dante (devil_may_cry)|]], his younger brother, he embraces his demonic heritage and despises his human one. His personality is a complete opposite to Dante's; whereas Dante is hot-headed and sarcastic, Vergil is cold-blooded and sardonic. He has a lust for power and is willing to disregard anything to obtain the power of his father, Sparda, a trait that stemmed from their mother's death, and his helplessness back then. 

When his lust for power didn't get in the way, he will at times ally with Dante, to the point of using Dante's guns, a weapon he personally despises.

He uses [[Yamato (sword)|]], a keepsake from his father, and possesses a sense of style which rivals Dante's. 

After being decimated in the story as Nelo Angelo, he is said to have been survived by his son, [[Nero (devil_may_cry)|]].

Voiced by Daniel Southworth.

h4. See Also
* [[Vergil's Chair (meme)|]]
* [[Vergil Status (meme)|]]
other_names: バージル(デビルメイクライ)

title: tokarev_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android girl representing the Russian-made [[Tokarev TT-33]] pistol in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A polite, well-spoken girl. 

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[silver hair]] and [[red eyes]]. body:
[[Marie Rose]]'s skin for [i]Vacation Lane[/i], [[Azur Lane]]'s collaboration with [[Dead or Alive Xtreme|Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation]].

It utilizes her Cymric [[one-piece swimsuit]], which first appeared as her second costume in [[Dead or Alive 5|Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate]] and then in [i]Dead or Alive Xtreme 3[/i], where it was given its name.

It consists of a [[blue one-piece swimsuit|blue]] [[frilled swimsuit|frilled]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg]] [[one-piece swimsuit]] with a [[red bow]]. The fighting costume version adds [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], and [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] [[blue thighhighs]].

title: changchun_(warship_girls_r)
body:
The personification of the Chinese guided missile destroyer [i]Changchun[/i] in [[Warship Girls R]]. She is the modified form of [[Reshitelny (warship girls r)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]], and wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]], [[white thighhighs]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] with a [[red star]] [[star hat ornament|ornament]]. Her alternate costume "The One and Only" is the same, but with a [[white dress]] sailor dress and short [[blue socks]]. Her [[machinery|ship parts]] include a [[thigh strap]] on her right leg with a gun turret mounted on it, and uniquely for Warship Girls R ship girls she has a pair of [[missile launcher]]s.

title: diamond_clan_outfit
body:
The outfit worn by members of the Diamond Clan in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

It consists of a [[blue hoodie]] with a [[Dialga]]-themed hood, over what appears to be a [[black kimono|black]] and [[blue kimono|blue]] [[two-tone kimono]], and a [[brown bag]]. The hoodie has the Clan's emblem on its chest. The male outfit has [[brown pants|brown]] or [[grey pants]] while the female one has [[aqua leggings|aqua]] and [[blue leggings|blue]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[leggings]]. The outfit also has [[black boots|black]] and [[red boots|red]] [[boots]], which are longer in the male outfit.

While generic NPCs wear the same clothes, wardens wear variations of this outfit, mostly with some accessory, or pants or leggings with a different color.

title: dice
body:
[b]Dice[/b] are small, throwable objects used to generate random values in various forms of gambling and a wide variety of games.

While six-sided, [[cube|cubical]] dice are by far the most common, [[polyhedral dice]] with [[d4_(die)|4]], [[d8_(die)|8]], [[d10_(die)|10]], [[d12_(die)|12]], and [[d20_(die)|20]] sides appear frequently in specific settings, particularly in table-top [[Dungeons & Dragons]] and its many descendants.

Although the singular form is [b]die[/b], use this tag regardless of how many dice are actually present in the picture.

h4. See also

* [[dice hair ornament]]: When dice are worn as accessories on the head (other than earrings).
* [[dice earrings]]: When dice are worn as earrings.

title: tetrahedron
body:
A [[polyhedron]] composed of four [[triangle|triangular]] faces. If all four faces are equilateral triangles, the tetrahedron is regular. Also known as a triangular [[pyramid (geometry)|]].

A compound of two regular tetrahedra is called a [[stellated octahedron]].

h4. Examples

h4. See also

title: tetsujin_28-gou
body:
A 1956-1966 [[mecha]] manga series by [[Yokoyama Mitsuteru]]. It has been adapted into several media franchises. 

It is notable for being one of the first [[super robot]] anime series ever made.

h4. Works

* [[Tetsujin 28-gou (classic)|]] (1963-1966), first anime series, also known as [i]GIGANTOR[/i] in America.
* [[Taiyou no Shisha Tetsujin 28-gou]] (1980-1981), second anime series.
* Chou-dendou Robo: [[Tetsujin 28-gou FX]] (1992~1993)
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou (2004)]], fourth series, adaptation of original manga and anime set in 50s-60s.
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou Hakuchuu no Zangetsu]] (2007 anime film)
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou Gao!]] (2013-2016)

h4. Characters

* [[Kaneda Shoutarou (tetsujin 28-gou)|]]
* [[Professor Shikishima]] (His first names varied depending on titles)
* [[Professor Furanken]]
* [[Cross Association]] ([i]Juuji Kessha[/i]) members
* [[Tetsujin 28]] (mecha)
* [[Black Ox]]
* [[Monster (tetsujin 28-gou)|]] 

h4. See also

* [[shota]] - the slang word "shotacon" was taken from [[Kaneda Shoutarou (tetsujin 28-gou)|]], main protagonist of this series

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tetsujin 28-go":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsujin_28-go

title: tetsujin_28-gou_(classic)
body:
The original manga and anime of the [[Tetsujin 28-gou]] series, first published from 1956 to 1966, while the anime ran from 1963 to 1966. It would later go on to serve as the primary inspiration for the [[tetsujin 28-gou (2004)|2004 anime series]].

This iteration of Tetsujin was aired in America under the localized title [b]Gigantor[/b], which dubbed 52 of the original 97 episodes.

title: super_robot
body:
[b]Super Robot[/b] (スーパーロボット [i]Sūpā Robotto[/i]) is an old genre of anime focused on giant [[robot]] [[mecha]] with various super powers, special and flashy weapons, and the cliche of attack/special move naming.

It originated from [[Tetsujin 28-Gou]] from the [[1950s_(style)|]]/[[1960s_(style)|]] and the [[Mazinger Z]] series created by [[Nagai Gou]] in the early [[1970s_(style)|]]. While not as popular as it was during its beginnings, it still continues to this day.

It evolved into the more realistic [b]"Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot [/b](リアルロボット [i]Riaru Robotto[/i]) anime genre started by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]'s [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] in the late [[1970s_(Style)|70s]] and early [[1980s_(style)|80s]]. This genre also continues to this day.

title: super_robot_wars_x-omega
body:
A [[Super Robot Wars]] mobile game launched in 2015. Due to it's nature as a gacha game, it constantly added new series for events and promotions, and quickly amassed the largest roster in the franchise. Character designs for the game's new original characters are provided by [[Watanabe Wataru (character designer)|]].

Following a sudden announcement on the official Twitter page, the game was shut down on March 30, 2021.

title: shogun_warriors
body:
Shogun Warriors was a short-lived [[Marvel]] comic series featuring licensed Japanese [[super robot]]s as part of the Marvel superhero universe. The comic series focused on three robots in particular - [[Raideen (mecha)|]] (renamed Raydeen), [[Combattler V (robot)|]] (renamed Combattra), and [[Danguard Ace]] (renamed Dangard Ace). The three robots were piloted by new original characters and the combiners were changed from multi-pilot units to single-pilot.

The comic series was an extension of Mattel's late 70s/early 80s toyline of the same name, which featured imported Japanese [[mecha]] toys from assorted anime  and [[tokusatsu]] series, as well as some [[kaiju]]. Apart from the robots listed above and some [[Super Sentai]] toys, the following were featured exclusively in the toyline.

* [[One-Seven]] from [[Daitetsujin 17]] (renamed to 17 Robot)
* [[Daimos]] from [[Toushou Daimos]] (renamed to Dynamo, as in the Starbirds dub)
* [[Getter Dragon]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Dragun, as in the Starvengers dub)
* [[Getter Liger]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Raiden)
* [[Getter Poseidon]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Poseidon, as in the Starvengers dub)
* [[Gaiking (dmg)|]] from [[Gaiking]]
* [[Grendizer]] from [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] (someties called Grandizer)
* [[Great Mazinger (robot)|]] from [[Great Mazinger]] (sometimes called Great Mazinger or simply Mazinga)
* [[Leopardon]] from [[Spider-Man (toei)|]] (with no references to Spider-Man himself made on the product)
* [[Voltes V (mecha)|]] from [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]]
* [[Getter-1]] from [[Getter Robo (classic)|]] (sold as a [[model kit]] only)
* [[Godzilla]]
* [[Rodan]]

title: cookie_(touhou)
body:
[b]Marisa and Alice's Cookie Kiss[/b], or [b]Cookie☆[/b] for short, is a [[Touhou]] voice drama that was uploaded on Valentine's Day 2010 featuring eight amateur voice actresses and over twenty artists.

The video received heavy criticism for being very boring and voiced by actresses who didn't really know Touhou, before receiving more hate after news broke of what Cookie☆'s creator [[Hazuna Rio]] did. The video's tags were vandalized and it attracted the [[Manatsu no Yo no Inmu]] fanbase who actually appreciated the cheesy storytelling and bad voice acting, resulting in Cookie☆ becoming a spin-off or even separate entity from Touhou. The drama resulted in the both accidental and intentional doxxing of all of the voice actresses and the creator.

A few months later, three other voice dramas popularly known together as "Cookie☆☆" were organized by [[Taisa (Cookie)|Taisa]] and picked up by Cookie☆ fans who remade these videos in [[mikumikudance|MMD]], with these voice actresses also getting doxxed. As Cookie☆'s popularity grew, many more voice dramas were made but this wiki only includes ones noteworthy enough to get fan art. 

Due to connections with the Inmu fanbase, fans typically refer to a character by an initialism of their name (e.g. Reu -> RU, Uzuki -> UDK, etc.) with either "Aniki" (兄貴, lit. "Big Brother") or "Aneki" (姉貴, lit. "Big Sister") attached to them at the end,  corresponding to the voice actor's gender. This is called "[[Tadano Kazuhito|TDN]] Notation" (TDN表記).

h4.Characters

h6. Original Cast ("Marisa and Alice's Cookie Kiss":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sHIYAaJ7CKg]) by [[Hazuna Rio]]

* [[Reu (cookie)|]] as [[Hakurei Reimu]] (see also: [[Sakenomi (cookie)|]], [[Reu Daikon]] and [[Ru (cookie)|]])
* [[Uzuki (Cookie)|Uzuki Kousei]] as [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[hinase (cookie)|Hinase Haruka]] as [[Alice Margatroid]] and [[Daiyousei]] ([[DIYUSI (cookie)|]]) (see also: [[Hinase Haruka]], [[SIYUDI (cookie)|]], and [[Chiibou (cookie)|]])
* [[Yamin (Cookie)|]] as [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Cirno]], and [[Patchouli Knowledge]]
* [[Genpatsu (cookie)|]] as [[Izayoi Sakuya]] (see also: [[Tsurikichi Obasan]])
* [[Nadeko (Cookie)|]] as [[Rumia]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]] (and as artist)
* [[Macota (Cookie)|]] as [[Kazami Yuuka]], [[Hong Meiling]], and [[Remilia Scarlet]] 
* [[Yuzuyu (Cookie)|]] as [[Koakuma]] and [[Mystia Lorelei]] 
* [[INU (Cookie)|]] as [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* [[TORI (cookie)|]] as [[Shameimaru Aya]]
* [[Garbage (cookie)|]] as [[Medicine Melancholy]] 
* [[Cirno (cookie)|]] on Reimu's tea container and background character
* [[Shishou (cookie)|]] as [[Onozuka Komachi]]
* [[The Chicken that Appears in the Middle of Cookie]]

Fans usually just call Alice "ALC", Rumia "RMA", and Suika "SIK" thanks to the TDN Notation.

title: orchid_(arknights)
body:
[i]Orchid, Supporter Operator of Rhodes Island, will provide support for the squad with her Originium Arts.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]

      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]164 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Former editor of a Columbian fashion magazine who began treatment at Rhodes Island following her Oripathy.

After she passed the examination, she was assigned to Reserve Op Team A6 as the squad leader.

Her voice actor is Ootsu Airi.

title: earthspirit_(arknights)
body:
[i]Earthspirit, Supporter Operator of Rhodes Island, will provide reliable support on the battlefield when she's on duty.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]April 5[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Caprinae[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A geologist from Leithanien. She is a specialist in fields such as environmental assessment, battlefield analysis, and terrain utilization. She currently serves with a support squad performing geological surveys, early Catastrophe warnings and other related services for Rhodes Island.

Her motif is based on mountain goats.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Yuuki Aoi]].

title: kisaragi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kisaragi[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hair ribbon]], and [[purple eyes|purple]]/[[brown eyes]] which depend on the artist. She and her sister [[Mutsuki (Kancolle)|]] wear a white version of the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]] with [[green sailor collar]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast on her back, a 12 cm single [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

In the third episode of the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] she sinks, leading to a surge of fanart shortly after that episode. See pool #9670. This is reflective of the real-life [i]Kisaragi[/i] being sunk in the battle of Wake Island in December 1941.

title: murakumo_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Murakumo[/i]. Character design by [[Ayaki]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[tress ribbon|red tress ribbons]] on her [[sidelocks]], [[orange eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Unlike the rest of the [i]Fubuki[/i]-class, she wears a short one-piece [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]], [[red necktie]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose]], [[loafers]] that double as [[rudder footwear]], and floating [[headgear]] over the sides of her head. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge as a backpack, two 12.7 cm twin gun mounts attached to it, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] mounted to her left wrist. She uses a [[spear]] as a melee weapon. She has a [[tsundere]] personality but is more open and less spiteful from the get-go than [[Akebono (kancolle)|]] and [[Kasumi (kancolle)|]]. h4. Appearance * !post #2093158: Base and kai * !post #1978931: [[Murakumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]] * !post #1920626: [[Murakumo (valentine) (kancolle)|Valentine]] h4. Related characters h6. Starter ships * [[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]] * [b]Murakumo[/b] * [[Sazanami (Kancolle)|]] * [[Inazuma (Kancolle)|]] * [[Samidare (Kancolle)|]] h4. title: isonami_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Isonami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a pair of [[braid|braids]] plus [[sidelocks]], and [[black eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's serafuku: a [[white shirt]] with [[blue sailor collar]], blue [[neckerchief]], [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is shared with the other Special-Types: her funnel to her back with a 12.7 cm twin gun mount and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her thighs. She has a [[shy]], [[nervous]], and "girly" personality, which makes for an odd pairing with her "younger sister" [[Uranami (Kancolle)|]], who is reliant upon Isonami despite Isonami being generally far less sure of herself than the rather enthusiastic Uranami. h4. title: sega_x_piapro_collaboration_contest
body:

title: kamikaze_pilot
body:
[b]Kamikaze[/b] (神風, lit. "divine wind" or "spirit wind") [[pilot]]s, officially known as the [b]Shinpuu Tokubetsu Kougekitai[/b] (神風特別攻撃隊, "Divine Wind Special Attack Unit"), were a part of the Japanese Special Attack Units of [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[military]] aviators who flew suicide attacks for the Empire of Japan against Allied naval vessels in the closing stages of the Pacific campaign of [[World War II]]. 

They were first deployed during the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]]. Their main purpose was to destroy warships more effectively than with conventional air attacks by crashing their explosive filled aircraft directly into the enemy ships. About 3,800 kamikaze pilots died during the war, and more than 7,000 U.S. naval personnel were killed by kamikaze attacks.

h4.See also

* [[Kaiten (weapon)|]]
* [[MXY-7 Ohka]]
* [[The Cockpit: Sonic Boom Squadron]]

title: ooshio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ooshio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[blue_hair|blue]]/[[purple_hair|purple]] hair in [[short twintails]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]]. 

She is a cheerful, high-spirited girl. Her catchphrase is "Big Torpedo In A Small Body!", which is sometimes jokingly referred to as a [[sexually suggestive]] phrase.

title: secret_level_(series)
body:
Secret Level is a 2024 animated anthology series created by Tim Miller for Amazon Prime. Produced by Blur Studio and Amazon MGM Studios, the series feature stand-along stories based on popular video games, both old and new including upcoming new games. The series is notable for having an A-List celebrity voice cast which includes [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] and [[Keanu Reeves]] and one episode was based on the video game [[Concord (game)|]], which was already cancelled by the time the episode was released. The 1st season aired on December 2024, with a 2nd season in the works.

h4. Games featured in Secret Level

title: quilladin
body:
[[Pokemon]] #651 in the National Pokédex, a Grass-type [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]]. 

It evolves from [[Chespin]] starting at level 16 and evolves into [[Chesnaught]] starting at level 36.  

Quilladin is a bipedal, mammalian Pokémon with some plant-like features. It is largely covered in an armor-like shell similar to that of a chestnut. The armor is green in coloration with two large spines jutting out like ears. These spines and its pointed tail have red tips, and there are banded segments on the back of the shell. The lower half of the body is brown, and it has a three-pointed patch of fur decorating the front. Quilladin's stubby limbs are brown, but the top surfaces of the arms are protected by green, banded armor. It has three white, clawed digits on its hands and two on its feet. The face is exposed and unarmored, being light brown in color. It has a small, pink nose and a pointed snout, with a three-pointed patch of [[brown fur]] extending out like hair. Brown triangles mark its cheeks. Quilladin also has wide eyes, [[buck teeth]], and usually wears a cheerful expression. 

Japanese Name: [b]Hariborg[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Chespin]]
Next Pokémon: [[Chesnaught]]

title: intrepid_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy carrier USS [i]Intrepid[/i] (CV-11). Character design by [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]], voiced by [[Kubota Hikari]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey dress]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] with an aviator's [[neck pillow]], [[blue neckerchief]] with her real-life [[camouflage]] pattern (Measure 32-D3A), [[grey socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and [[radar]] masts to her back, and her [[flight deck]] to her left. Like other US carrier shipgirls, she brandishes a firearm to "launch" her aircraft, in this case an [[M1903 Springfield]] [[rifle]] with two 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] on top. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3029966: Base
* !post #3029962: [[Intrepid Kai (kancolle)|Kai]]
* !post #8643219: [[Intrepid (new year) (kancolle)|New Year]]
* !post #3792120: [[Intrepid (mitsukoshi) (kancolle)|Mitsukoshi collab]]

Her introduction into the game on the morning (Japan time) of February 22, 2018 drew mixed reactions from Western fans with the negative side taking issue with her design which is not helped by her artist's [[shibafu_(glock23)_(style)|already notorious art style]]. Her first appearance and the negative initial reactions coincided with the temporary suspension of the game's Twitter account that day, leading some Western fans to connect the perceived rage against Intrepid's design to the suspension (which was actually for unrelated reasons). In comparison, the Japanese fanbase was much more receptive for Intrepid's design with the initial negative reactions being lukewarm.

h4. See also

* [[Intrepid (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Intrepid[/i] (CV-11)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Intrepid_(CV-11)]
* "Intrepid Sea-Air-Space Museum website":https://www.intrepidmuseum.org/

title: konosuba!_fantastic_days
body:
[b]KonoSuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! Fantastic Days[/b] is a Japanese smartphone gaming app published by Sumzap for Android and iOS. Based on the [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|KonoSuba]] series, it was released in early 2020. Service for the game on personal computer was later commenced in early 2024.

It is a party-based battle RPG that features an original story, full voice acting, and SD character designs for regular characters such as [[Satou_Kazuma|Kazuma]], [[aqua (konosuba)|Aqua]], [[Darkness (konosuba)|Darkness]], [[Wiz (konosuba)|Wiz]], [[Megumin]], [[Yunyun (konosuba)|Yunyun]], and more.

Online service for the game ended on January 30, 2025, though an offline version was announced to be in development.

title: alfonsino_(fish)
body:
A deep-sea fish belonging to the family Berycidae (order Beryciformes), known for its striking red coloration and adaptations to life in the ocean's depths.

Appearance:
* Bright red or orange-red body, silvery-pink underside, and red fins/mouth lining. This coloration acts as camouflage in deep waters where red light is absorbed.
* Large eyes with a reflective layer (tapetum lucidum) to enhance vision in low-light environments.
* Deep, laterally compressed body, forked caudal fin, and elongated pelvic/dorsal fins.

title: ishar-mla_(arknights)
body:
The sea dragon-like Leviathan named Ishar'mla, titled the "Corrupting Heart," is one of the four "Firstborn" of the Seaborn representing the power of "Migration." For millenia, He was sleeping deep within the "Mantle Ruins", an abandoned First Civilization underwater complex that Aegirians believe it was the birthplace of their civilization. It wouldn't be until 200 years ago when Maritimus, the famous anthropologist who was heading Aegir´s Fourth Mantle Ruins Expedition, made contact with Ishar'mla while exploring the ruins, awakening which led to him to be plagued by strange visions about the ancient civilization's downfall, and Ishar'mla devoring anything at His pass. He would later become a Seaborn after eating one of Ishar'mla's cubs not long after.

Ishar'mla was thought to be slain by the Abyssal Hunters during the great assault against the Leviathans as they were hiding within the ancient ruins of the abyss. However, it turns out that Ishar'mla's blood has merged with Skadi after the devastating battle and remained dormant for years. Due to its divine nature and His aggressiveness, the Sea Terrors tremble before Ishar'mla and the higher Seaborn refer to Him as their close kin.

title: arachnophobia
body: An intense and often irrational fear of [[spider]]s and other arachnids (such as [[scorpion]]s, mites, and [[tick]]s). It is one of the most common specific phobias, affecting many people worldwide. While it’s normal for some individuals to be cautious or uneasy around spiders, arachnophobia goes beyond mild discomfort—it can cause severe anxiety, distress, and sometimes panic attacks.
